loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tea tree seedlings.

loans.name: Fema

texts.en: Fema, 57, is married and has four children. Fema resides in San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been in this business for seven years. Each month, she earns 4,800 PHP. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand product offerings. In 2008, Fema joined GDMPC. In the future, Fema wants to build a house and for her children to complete their studies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offerings.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en: Celia is married to Abner, who works as a government employee. She is 48 years old and blessed with three children. Sending them to college is very costly. Celia hopes that her children will finish their studies with her financial support. To help her husband in providing for the growing needs of their children, Celia began selling beauty soaps. She gets orders from people in her community and then purchases her products in Tumauini, Isabela. She also maintains a hog-raising business in their home. To further grow both of her businesses, Celia is requesting a loan for PHP 31,000 from Kiva lenders. She hopes to obtain a loan from lenders to have her business raise more capital. She plans to purchase beauty soaps and a feed supply for her hogs to help them grow bigger. She hopes that her loan will be funded so that her businesses will remain stable.

loans.use: To buy feed and medicine for her pigs

loans.name: Belkis

texts.en:
Belkis is one of our associates from El Seybo, a rural town whose economy depends on agriculture. She has been running a small cafeteria and a beauty salon for about five years after starting the business with her savings. This is her second loan. Her business has been improving and expanding with more clients and products. She will invest this loan in her beauty salon by purchasing cosmetics, hair and beauty products. She sells the products to her clients and neighbors, especially women.

Belkis lives with her two children and her husband in their simple home in one of the neighborhoods outside of El Seybo. She said that her most difficult challenge was her beautician studies, because her children were too small and she didn't want someone else taking care of them. She enjoys to be with her family and to serve the Lord. She plans to save the profits for future investments and needs. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, hair and beauty products.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 31 years old and married.  She lives with her husband and their two school-aged children in the province of Isabela. 

She is a very devoted mother, and she works hard at providing motorcycle services. She tries to ensure that her passengers are comfortable on the road and arrive on time. She is applying for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy spare parts for her motorcycle, including new tires. 

She dreams of earning enough money to repair and improve her house so her children will have a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites, 33, is married and the mother of four children. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Marites plants rice and harvests it to sell to earn a living. She's doing this for 15 years. She earns 19,000 PHP quarterly from her farm. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for the next cropping. Marites been a member of GDMPC since 2011 In the future, Marites hopes to gain more profit and purchase a rice field.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for the next cropping.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila tiene 29 años, es una mujer muy simpática, vive en la casa que compró hace 2 años, junto a su esposo, Rolando, y sus tres hijos.  
Ellos se dedican a la agricultura. Tienen 7 años de experiencia en la siembra de papa, alverja y maíz. Su trabajo consiste en el cuidado de sus cultivos, todas las mañanas, desde muy temprano, y hasta altas horas de la noche. “Tenemos que caminar por horas para poder llegar a nuestros terrenos agrícolas”, comenta Lucila. Su trabajo en fertilizar los terrenos y sacar la maleza que crece entre los surcos, lo realizan gracias al apoyo que reciben de parte de sus hijos. También ha comenzado con el negocio de compra y venta de animales, para poder tener un ingreso adicional.

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Puntaman puririsum Sachamarca”, que en español significa “Adelante caminemos Sachamarca”. Este es el crédito número 12 que tiene con MFP y le gusta mucho el trabajo que realiza en su grupo, pues en cada reunión aprende nuevas ideas para sus sembríos, ya que todos se ayudan y cooperan, por ello promete ser puntual en pago de sus cuotas.
Lucila invertirá este dinero en la compra de 180 sacos de fertilizantes para su próxima siembra de papa de las variedades “Yungay”, “peruanita” y “canchan”.
texts.en:
Lucila, 29, is a very nice woman who lives with her husband, Rolando, and their three children in a house that she bought 2 years ago.
She has been a farmer for 7 years and plants potatoes, beans and corn.  Her work consists of caring for the plants by starting very early every morning and working until late at night.  “We have to walk for hours to arrive at our fields”, she says.  Thanks to the help that her children give her, she is able to fertilize the fields, and pull the weeds that grow between the rows.  Lucila also has started to buy and sell animals in her business to have additional income.

She belongs to the Puntaman Puririsum Sachamarca communal bank, which in Spanish means “Sachamarca Goes Ahead”.  This is her 12th loan with MFP and she really likes to work with the group because she learns new ideas about her planting in each meeting that she attends and all members help and cooperate.  She promises to be punctual with all her payments.
Lucila will use the money to buy 180 sacks of fertilizer for her next potato planting of the Yungay, Peruanita and Canchan varieties.

loans.use: to buy 180 sacks of fertilizer for her next potato planting

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en: Arlyn, 40, is married and has two children.  She resides in Curvada, Tukuran. Arlyn owns and operate a farm, planting and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living. She's been in this business for 19 years. Each month, she earns 10,000 PHP. She requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. In 2008, Arlyn joined GDMPC. Arlyn wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en: Margie, 45, is married with four children. She has a retail business selling a variety of products in her community. Margie is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. She dreams of someday having her own stall so that she can meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy shirts, shorts and blouses for her store.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is married with three grown children.  She is a very responsible mother and wife from the province of Isabela. 

She is engaged in selling a variety of products in order to sustain the needs of her family.  She is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy more goods, such as snack foods, spices, and drinks, for her store to have additional income. 

Raquel wish to improve her business so her children can keep going to school and also have a better life.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, spices, and drinks for her store.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 52 years old and lives with her children and husband in a house in the village of Carikrikan province of Isabela. 

Elisa has a grocery shop. She has gained much business experience in her field. 

With her profits earned from the business, she pays the tuition fees of her children. She is a diligent and open-minded woman who says, "I will devote my everything to my family." 

She is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan to purchase more grocery products, like canned goods, spices, drinks, rice, oil, and sugar, from the local market to display in her store and sell in the community.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, spices, drinks, and snack foods for her store

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en: Manuel is 56 years old and married, residing in Tabuan, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines. Manuel plants, harvests and sells rice for a living and has been in this business for 15 years. Each month, he earns 10,000 PHP from this business. He requested a loan of 18,000 PHP to pay labor costs for land plowing. In 2010, Manuel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. In the future, Manuel wants to have a reserve fund for future emergencies and to purchase more farmland.

loans.use: to pay labor costs for land plowing.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en: Yolanda is married and has seven children. She describes herself as industrious, intelligent, and honest. She operates a rolling store where she sells onions, tomatoes, fruits, and cabbage. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are local households and travelers. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate space for her business operations. She will use the 11,000 PHP loan to purchase fresh produce and maize to sell. Her business goal is to become involved in the sale of ready-made clothing within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to buy fresh produce and maize to sell.

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.es:
Lucinda tiene 25 años, vive en la casa que heredó desde hace 4 años, junto a su esposo Edgar y su hijo Jhon. 
Hace 5 años comenzó en el campo de la agricultura, junto a su esposo se distribuyen las responsabilidades del hogar, pues no solo a eso se dedican. Por su lado, Lucinda cuida de sus animales, cría cerdos, ovejas, vacas y toros, los que engorda y vende posteriormente. Mientras su esposo se encarga de administrar los sembríos de papa, habas, alverja y maíz. “Ambos tenemos que trabajar, en las épocas de siembra y cosecha, hay mucho trabajo”, afirma. Como siembran en cantidad, no se abastecen con sus terrenos por lo que tienen que arrendar unos alternos, por eso desea con muchas ansias mejorar sus ingresos, para poder ahorrar y comprar más tierras y no gastar en el pago del alquiler.

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Puntaman puririsum Sachamarca”, que en español significa “Adelante caminemos Sachamarca”. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y le gusta mucho el trabajo que realiza en su grupo, pues en cada reunión aprende nuevas ideas para sus sembríos, ya que todos se ayudan y cooperan, por ello promete ser puntual en pago de sus cuotas. 
Lucinda invertirá ahora en la compra de 30 sacos de fertilizantes naturales y si el dinero le alcanza comprará un par de ovejas.
texts.en:
Lucinda is 25 years old, and she lives in the house that she inherited four years ago along with her husband Edgar and their son Jhon.  Five years ago she began working in the field of agriculture.  Together with her husband they share the household responsibilities since that is not the only thing that they are dedicated to.  For her part, Lucinda takes care of their animals, raising pigs, sheep, cows and bulls, which she fattens and then sells.  Her husband, meanwhile, is in charge of organizing the planting of potatoes, beans, corn and peas.  "We both have to work, since in the periods of planting and harvesting, there is a lot of work," she affirms.  Because they plant in quantity, their lands are not sufficient, so they have to rent some fields, and for this reason she greatly desires to improve their income, so that they can save and buy more land and not spend so much on rent.

She belongs to the communal bank "Puntaman puririsum Sachamarca," which in Spanish means "Adelante caminemos Sachamarca" and in English "Walking Forward Together (in the town of) Sachamarca."  This is her third credit with MFP and she very much likes the work that she accomplishes with her group.  In each meeting she learns new ideas for planting crops, since everyone helps and cooperates, and for that reason she promises to be punctual in the payment of her fees.  

Lucinda will invest now in the purchase of 30 sacks of natural fertilizers and if there is sufficient money she will also buy a pair of sheep.

loans.use: To buy 30 sacks of natural fertilizers and if the money is sufficient, to buy a pair of sheep.

loans.name: Marie Gay Rose

texts.en: “Time is Gold” is the guiding principle of Marie Gay. Marie, as she is known, is married to Merlito. The couple has two school-age children. She wants to use her time as much as possible to be productive in her business. She needs to be patient to be able to provide for the needs of her children, especially when it comes to their education. Marie runs a general store in her village. She buys commodities in Cauayan, Isabela, once a month. She has been in business for seven years and she tries to maintain it for the sake of her children. Marie is requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase canned goods, noodles and spices for her business. Since joining this organization almost five years ago, her retail business has become more successful and she is always thankful for it. She hopes that it will be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles and spices for her business.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario has lived in Barangay Magsaysay all her life. The place is a relatively peaceful and progressive village. Agriculture is the major source of income for most of the residents here. Most of the women are engaged in other businesses as alternative sources of income.
Rosario is married to Nolie and blessed with four children. Her husband works in an electronic shop in Manila, but his salary is insufficient to provide for all their needs.
In order to help her husband, Rosario started to raise chickens in their backyard. After 40 days, they sell the chickens to their neighbors and regular customers. Rosario has had her poultry business for two years, and she plans to expand it by purchasing 20 chicks. This will bring in more income and savings for her family. To fulfill her plan, she requests a loan of PHP 9,000 which she plans to use to buy more chicks and feed and medicine for her chickens.
Rosario acts as the mother and father of their four children because her husband works in Manila and only comes home once every four months to minimize travel expenses. Her fellow villagers know her as a dedicated businesswoman and a responsible mother. She will sacrifice a lot for the welfare of her children and for them to have good education.

loans.use: Buy more chicks, feed and medicine for the chickens

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia, 48, a very hardworking woman, married and has two grown-up children. She has been a vegetable and fruit vendor for four years, earning a monthly income of PHP 5,000. To buy additional products, such as tomatoes, eggplant, cabbage and spices for her store, she is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000. She is able to support the needs of her family. She hopes that her business expands to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, eggplant, cabbage and spices for her store.

loans.name: Edlie

texts.en:
Edlie sells “halo-halo,” a popular snack that contains different fruits, such as banana, jack fruit, cassava, and coconut, and other flavorings, such as ice and milk. This has been her business for 24 years, and it has helped her family to survive. She generates an income of PHP 6,000 from her business every month. 

She dreams about expanding her business by acquiring additional capital of PHP 10,000. She plans to buy more supplies for her business, such as glasses, spoons, containers, and other materials that will be very helpful.  She anticipates for a higher income with help from ASKI. 

Edlie is a 48-year-old woman. Her family lives in the village of Magsaysay. Harley, her loving husband, is a well-known carpenter in their village. They still send their four children to school, which is why the couple works hard. They hope to support all their children's educational needs so they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her halo-halo business

loans.name: Honorata

texts.en:
Honorata is from the Sto.Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 44 years old and married, with four children. 

Honorata buys and sells bananas for a living.  She been in her business for three years and earns 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Honorata joined Kiva partner GDMPC. 

Honorata is requesting a loan of 6,500 PHP, which will be used to buy more bananas to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Herminigildo

texts.en: Herminigildo, a 47-year-old man, is full of love and determination for his family. He is married to Mildred. He makes sure that he can provide for the daily needs of his family. That's why he is requesting a loan of PHP 28,000 to buy a sack of fertilizer and rice seeds for his farm business. Aside from farming, he is also engaged in pig fattening. Herminigildo hopes that someday he can give a higher quality of life to his wife and children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for his farm

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 50 years old and married, with five children. 

To make a living, she manages the planting and harvesting of rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for 15 years and earns PHP 10,000 a month for these activities. In 2009, Lilia joined GDMPC. 

Lilia is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000, which will be used to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her rice field.

loans.name: Bety

texts.es:
Bety tiene 40 años, vive en una casa alquilada, desde hace 4 años, junto a sus dos hijos; Jaqueline y Alexander. 
Le gusta mucho trabajar en el campo, desde niña aprendió todo lo necesario para comenzar en este negocio. Posee terrenos agrícolas propios, pero no se abastece en la producción por lo que tiene que alquilar otros. Ya tiene 20 años de experiencia, sembrando papa, habas y tarwi (especie de frejol, pero más pequeño), los que cada día cuida con mucha dedicación, pues los alimentos son muy cotizados cuando son de buena calidad. Ahora desea ahorrar lo necesario para comprar más terrenos agrícolas y de esa manera producir en mayor cantidad. Por esa razón, también se dedica a la compra y venta de animales, los engorda y vende en la feria de la ciudad.

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Puntaman puririsum Sachamarca”, que en español significa “Adelante caminemos Sachamarca”. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP y le gusta mucho el trabajo que realiza en su grupo, pues en cada reunión aprende nuevas ideas para sus sembríos, ya que todos se ayudan y cooperan, por ello promete ser puntual en pago de sus cuotas.
Bety invertirá este dinero en la compra de 50 bolsas de fertilizantes naturales para su próxima siembra de papa.
texts.en:
Bety is 40 years old. She has lived in a rented house for 4 years with her two children, Jaqueline and Alexander. 

She really likes to work in the fields. When she was a little girl she learned everything she needed to start this business. She owns her own farmland, but it doesn't produce enough so she rents more. She has 20 years experience planting potatoes, beans and tarwi (a type of bean, but smaller). She cares for them every day with a lot of hard work, because the products are very popular because they are of good quality.  Now she wants to save up enough to buy more farmland and in this way produce in greater quantities. For that reason, she also buys and sells animals, fattens them up and sells them in the city market.

She belongs to the “Puntaman Puririsum Sachamarca” communal bank. In English this means “Let's Walk Ahead Sachamarca”. This is her fifth loan with MFP and she really likes the work that she does in the group. At every meeting she learns new ideas for her crops, since everyone helps and cooperates. That is why she promises to make her payments on time.

Bety will invest this money in buying 50 bags of organic fertilizer for her next potato crop.

loans.use: to buy 50 bags of organic fertilizer for her next crop of potatoes.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is from Taguitic, Kapatagan. She is 44 years old and married,  with three children. 

To make a living, Lolita buys and sells crabs and shrimp. She has been engaged in her business for six years and earns PHP 20,000 a month for these activities. In 2011, Lolita joined GDMPC. 

Lolita is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000, which will be used to buy more crabs and shrimp to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy more crabs and shrimp to sell.

loans.name: Milanda

texts.es:
Milanda tiene 28 años, vive en la casa de su madre desde hace 5 años, junto a su esposo Zósimo y sus tres hijos.  
Mientras su esposo trabaja en la compra y venta de animales, los que engorda para luego venderlos en la feria de la zona; Milanda se encarga de los terrenos de cultivo, tiene 9 años de experiencia en la siembra de papa y maíz y le gusta mucho trabajar en el campo; lo que no le gusta es tener que levantarse temprano, pasar frio y hacer mucho esfuerzo físico; “a veces sufrimos trabajando en el campo”, afirma. Pero ve su esfuerzo recompensado en cada cosecha, ya que sabe que obtendrá el pago por su esfuerzo y constancia.

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Puntaman puririsum Sachamarca”, que en español significa “Adelante caminemos Sachamarca”. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP y le gusta mucho el trabajo que realiza en su grupo, pues en cada reunión aprende nuevas ideas para sus sembríos, ya que todos se ayudan y cooperan, por ello promete ser puntual en pago de sus cuotas.
Milanda invertirá este dinero en la compra de 195 sacos de fertilizantes naturales para sus próximos sembríos de papa y maíz.
texts.en:
Milanda is 28 years old. She has lived in her mother's house for 5 years with her husband Zósimo and their three children.   
While her husband works buying and selling animals, which he fattens up and later sell sin the area market, Milanda takes care of the crops. She has 9 years experience growing potatoes and corn and she really likes working in the fields. What she doesn't like is having to get up early, feel the cold and do a lot of physical labor. “Sometimes we suffer working in the fields" she affirms. But she sees her hard work rewarded in every harvest, since she knows she will be paid for her hardwork and constancy.

She belongs to the “Puntaman Puririsum Sachamarca” communal bank. In English this means “Let's Get Ahead Sachamarca”. This is her sixth loan with MFP and she really likes the work she does in the group. In every meeting she learns new ideas for her crops, since everyone helps each other an cooperates. That is why she promises to make her payments on time.

Milanda will invest the money in buying 195 sacks of organic fertilizer for her next potato and corn crops.

loans.use: to buy 195 bags of organic fertilizer for her next ppotato and corn crops.

loans.name: Heam's Group

texts.en:
Heam is 49 years old and married, with three children, one of whom, a son, is dependent on her.  Heam is from a rural area located in the MongKul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province, 

She and her husband have struggled to feed their children by raising pigs and by working for others for ten years to make a living. They can earn about KHR 20,000 per day to meet family’s needs, and they are able to save about KHR 10,000 each day. 

Heam has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for six cycles,  She successfully paid back all those loans, while the other group members have been from three to four cycles. The past loans have helped her relieve her family’s burden and improve her livelihood. 

Now she is leading the group of three who live in the same village to ask for a loan with VisionFund. Heam is going to use her portion to buy pig feed and a portion of it to buy piglets for raising. She hopes to make more income so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and piglets for raising

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
Ruel is 37 years old and married. He lives with his wife and his two grown children in the village of Burgos, Province of Isabela. 

He is engaged in agriculture, growing corn and rice.  He has worked in agriculture, growing rice, for the last ten years. He purchases his supplies in the town of Ilagan, and sells his products in the market there. 

The requested loan of  PHP 28,000 is for the purchase of seeds and fertilizers for growing corn and rice. The loan will help him to increase his income for use by his family and for investment. 

His dream is to buy a plot of land that he can continue to plant on. In his free time, he really enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for his farming business

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Sheila is 44 years old and married, with five children. She is from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur.

She owns and operates a retail store at home to earn a living. For five years of running the store, Sheila gets PHP 10,000 a month. In 2007, Sheila joined GDMPC. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000, which will be used to buy additional products to sell, such as grocery items and school and office supplies. Sheila hopes for further improvement of the business operations to gain more income.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell, such as grocery items and school and office supplies.

loans.name: Rodel

texts.en:
Rodel is a 33-year-old man from the village of Burgos, province of Isabela.  He is married, with one daughter. He is a man with patience and determination, according to his wife, Robenita. 

Rodel is requesting a loan of PHP 28,000 to buy fertilizer and seed for his farm business. Aside from farming, he is also engaged in raising livestock such as pigs and poultry. In the future, Rodel hopes that he can supply the necessities for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed for his farm.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 38 años, vive en la casa de su madre, junto a sus dos hijos: Jhony y Maribel.
Se caracteriza por ser amable y trabajadora, tiene 15 años de experiencia en la agricultura y continúa sembrando en terrenos que le heredó su madre. Ahora no puede trabajar como antes, porque tiene problemas con el pie derecho, pero no se desanima, pues es una mujer que le gustan los retos. Hace un año abrió una pequeña tienda de comestibles en su vivienda, donde vende productos de primera necesidad. Su tienda está un poco llena, pero ella desea surtirla más y así tener contentos a sus clientes, pues en su pueblo existen pocas tiendas.

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Puntaman puririsum Sachamarca”, que en español significa “Adelante caminemos Sachamarca”. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP y le gusta mucho el trabajo que realiza en su grupo, pues en cada reunión aprende nuevas ideas para sus sembríos, ya que todos se ayudan y cooperan, por ello promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas.
Julia invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de sacos de arroz y azúcar para su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Julia is 36 years old. She lives in her mother's house along with her two children, Jhony and Maribel. She is known for being friendly and hard-working. She has 15 years of experience in agriculture and continues to plant on the land that she inherited from her mother. Now she cannot work as she did before, because she has problems with her right foot, but she does not become discouraged, since she is a woman who likes challenges. A year ago she opened a little grocery store in her home, where she sells basic products. Her store is a little full, but she wants to stock it more and thus keep her customers happy, since there are few stores in her town.

She belongs to the communal bank "Puntaman puririsum Sachamarca," which means "We go forward Sachamarca" (Sachamarca is the name of a local stream). This is her fifth loan from MFP, and she very much likes the work that she does in her group, because at every meeting she learns new ideas for her crops, since everyone helps each other and cooperates. This is why she promises to be punctual in her loan payments.

Julia will invest the money from this loan in the purchase of sacks of rice and sugar for her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and sugar for her store.

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina is from Lower Tiparak, Tambulig. She is 55 years old and married, with three children. 

To make a living, Felomina raises rice for sale. She has been in her business for eight years, and she earns 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2011, Felomina joined GDMPC. 

Felomina is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue, generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure for her rice field.

loans.name: Srang's Group

texts.en:
Srang is 42 years old and a single woman.  She is a rural villager from the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia,  

The main source of family’s income is from rice farming for 20 years. She is able to earn about 10,000 KHR per day from the current business. Lack of water supply for her paddy field is still the main challenge for Srang. 

This is the third loan for her with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, while for her group member, it is the fifth loan. The past loans have made a better living for her family. 

Now leading the group of two to ask for a loan with VisionFund, Srang will use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seed for her farmland and a portion of it to pay for labor costs. She hopes to make more income so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seed for her farmland

loans.name: Aries

texts.en:
Aries, 33, lives with Luz and they have two grown children. They live in their own home in the community of Burgos, in Isabela province. 

Aries is a very hardworking man. He farms two parcels of land, cultivating corn and rice. The Burgos area is highly sought after because the land and climate are very good for growing. Every year, Aries harvests 17,000 kilos, which he successfully sells in the city of Ilagan, Isabela. 

Aries enjoys his work because he can be more independent and, most of all, because his income depends upon his own efforts. In order to facilitate his work, he hires people to help him plant his crops. Next month, Aries is planning to plant other products, such as vegetables, on land rented from neighbors or friends. He will be responsible for making his payments on time. 

Aries will use the money from this loan to buy sacks of fertilizer and seeds to grow and to pay workers to clear and cultivate his lands.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
After 15 years of working for several companies and never gaining the opportunity to move up in a company, Deborah decided to open her own business while simultaneously helping other local businesses. As a registered communications distributor designer (RCCD), Deborah created EP Techworks in her hometown of El Paso. She works with other entrepreneurs and architects to discuss the design and installation of technical communication devices. Her business is one of two within the entire city that is 100 per cent owned by Hispanic women. Deborah had special training to learn about fiber optics, wireless devices, computer set-ups, projectors, intercoms, speakers, projectors and similar communication devices. 

Deborah says she got into the industry to help bring other companies into the 21st century. “I love this business because it’s different every day. The projects differ and change daily, and I’m not the type that can do the same thing every day.” Deborah has had her business for three years and now has 12 full-time staff members. In the future, she plans to hire more Hispanic female workers to keep up her Hispanic female business status.

After hearing about Accion Texas Inc. from her banker, Deborah decided to inquire about a loan. Upon approval, she used the loan for a truck and marketing. She says that since she got the loan, she has put advertisement on her truck and has received a large number of calls. Most importantly, she has a more efficient way to service her clients and not cause too much wear and tear on her employees’ cars. 

Find out more about her business on her website: ep-techworks.com and Facebook page: www.facebook.com/pages/EP-Techworks/144833275613546

loans.use: to pay for a truck and advertisement.

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.es:
Leoncio tiene 51 años, vive en la casa que compró desde hace 36 años, ahora sólo está con uno (David) de sus cuatro hijos.
Enviudó hace 4 años, desde entonces ya no recibe el apoyo de su esposa quien siempre lo acompañaba en las largas jornadas de cosecha y siembra. Se siente un poco triste cuando cuenta sobre ella, afirma que su amor por sus hijos y su alegría, lo motivaron a salir adelante. Gracias a su trabajo logró adquirir diez hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas propios, solo siembra en cuatro hectáreas papa, habas y maíz, y las demás las heredó a sus hijos. Ahora trabaja con el apoyo de peones, a quienes contrata cuando necesita ayuda, gusta mucho de trabajar en el campo, por ello se siente muy contento en cada cosecha, ya que obtiene la recompensa de tanto esfuerzo.

Él pertenece al banco comunal “Puntaman puririsum Sachamarca”, que en español significa “Adelante caminemos Sachamarca”. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP y le gusta mucho el trabajo que realiza en su grupo, pues en cada reunión aprende nuevas ideas para sus sembríos, ya que todos se ayudan y cooperan, por ello promete ser puntual en pago de sus cuotas.
Leoncio invertirá este dinero en la compra de 200 sacos de fertilizantes naturales para su próximo sembrío de papa de las variedades “canchan” y “única”.
texts.en:
Leoncio is 51 years old. He lives in the house that he bought 36 years ago. Now he lives with only one (David) of his four children. He was widowed 4 years ago, so since then he no longer receives the help of his wife, who always accompanied him during the long workdays of harvesting and planting. He feels a little sad when he talks about her. He affirms that his love for his children and their happiness motivate him to move forward. Thanks to his work he managed to acquire 10 hectares of his own agricultural land. He plants only 4 hectares with potatoes, beans, and corn, and the others he gave to his children. Now he works with the help of laborers, whom he hires when he needs help. He very much likes to work in the fields, and for this reason he feels very happy at each harvest, since he obtains the reward for so much work.

He belongs to the communal bank "Puntaman puririsum Sachamarca," which means "We go forward Sachamarca" (Sachamarca is the name of a local stream). This is his eighth loan from MFP, and he very much likes the work that he does in his group, because at every meeting he learns new ideas for his crops, since everyone helps each other and cooperates. For this reason he promises to be punctual in making his payments.

Leoncio will invest this money in the purchase of 200 sacks of natural fertilizer for the next planting of potatoes of the varieties "Canchan" and "Unica."

loans.use: to buy 200 sacks of natural fertilizer for his next planting of potatoes

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es:
Mariana tiene 29 años, vive en la casa que compró hace 12 años, junto a su esposo Jony y sus cuatro hijos pequeños.  
Hace apenas 2 años comenzó su camino por la agricultura, desde niña vivió en el campo y ayudó a sus padres a cuida la tierra, por ello no le es difícil ese trabajo. Sus terrenos se ubican en una zona fértil que proporciona productos variados y de buena calidad. Sus cultivos constan de maíz, papa, alverja y otras hortalizas, las que cuida, fertiliza y cosecha, todos los días desde las primeras horas del día hasta el atardecer; “cuando llega la noche, nos sentimos muy cansados, pero sabemos que en la cosecha podremos ver el resultado de nuestro esfuerzo”, menciona. Ahora comenzó a incursionar en la compra y venta de ovejas y cerdos, donde obtiene un dinero extra para el hogar. 

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Puntaman puririsum Sachamarca”, que en español significa “Adelante caminemos Sachamarca”. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y le gusta mucho el trabajo que realiza en su grupo, pues en cada reunión aprende nuevas ideas para sus sembríos, ya que todos se ayudan y cooperan, por ello promete ser puntual en pago de sus cuotas.
Mariana invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de 20 ovejas pequeñas.
texts.en:
Mariana is 29 years old and lives in the house she bought 12 years ago, together with her husband Jony and their four small children. 

Almost 2 years ago, she began her journey in agriculture.  Since she was a child, she has lived in the country and helped her parents take care of the earth, so this work isn't difficult for her.  Her fields are located in a fertile area that provides a variety of good quality produce.  Her crops consist of corn, potatos, peas, and other vegetables that she tends, fertilizes and harvests, working everyday from the early hours of the morning until dusk.  "When night arrives, we feel very tired, but we know that in the harvest, we will see the results of our efforts," she mentions.  Now she has begun to enter into the purchase and sale of sheep and pigs, so she can obtain extra money for her home.

She belongs to the community bank “Puntaman puririsum Sachamarca”, which means "We walk forward Sachamarca."  This is her third loan with MFP and she enjoys the work that she does with her group.  In each meeting, she learns new ideas for her plants, since all help and cooperate with each other.  For that, she promises to be punctual with her payments.

Mariana will invest the money from this loan in the purchase of 20 small sheep.

loans.use: to purchase 20 small sheep.

loans.name: Saroub's Group

texts.en:
Saroub, 50, is married with five children, three of whom are dependent on her and work as paid workers. Her family lives in a house with thatch located in Banteay Meanchey province’s Mongkul Borey district in Cambodia. The main source of the family’s income is farming rice on one hectare. Saroub has been in this business for ten years, earning about 20,000 riels (KHR) per day. She is able to save about 10,000 KHR each day.

Saroub received her first loan with VisionFund one cycle ago and completely paid back the past loan. She has effectively used it to relieve her family’s burden and save some money to buy a motor for commuting. Now she is leading this group of three women applying for a loan with VisionFund. Saroub will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income from the crop yield so as to achieve her dream of buying extra plots of farmland for expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia tiene 36 años, vive en la casa que compró hace 15 años, junto a su esposo Guillermo y sus cinco hijos. 
Ahora se encuentra cosechando maíz y limpiando la maleza de sus cultivos de papa. Los 10 años de experiencia que tiene en la agricultura le dieron la paciencia para saber cómo obtener una buena producción de sus tierras. Tuvo que trabajar mucho para conseguir sus propios terrenos agrícolas, ahora ya produce y no gasta en el alquiler, eso le proporciona más ingresos. Todas las mañanas, desde las primeras horas del día, hasta el atardecer, trabaja en el campo, limpiando, fertilizando y cuidando a sus animales, como cerdos, chanchos y ovejas, los que engorda para luego vender a más precio. Comercializa su producción en la ciudad donde tiene compradores fijos, quienes saben de su esfuerzo y calidad de sus productos.

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Puntaman puririsum Sachamarca”, que en español significa “Adelante caminemos Sachamarca”. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP y le gusta mucho el trabajo que realiza en su grupo, pues en cada reunión aprende nuevas ideas para sus sembríos, ya que todos se ayudan y cooperan, por ello promete ser puntual en pago de sus cuotas.
Sonia invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 200 sacos de fertilizantes naturales para sus sembríos de papa.
texts.en:
Sonia is 36 years old. She lives in the house that she bought 15 years ago, along with her husband Guillermo and their five children.

Now she is planting corn and cleaning the weeds from her plantings of potatoes. The 10 years of experience that she has in agriculture give her the patience to know how to obtain good production from her land. She had to work a lot to obtain her own agricultural land. Now she produces and does not spend money on rent -- this gives her more income. Every morning, from the first hours of the day until dusk, she works in the field, cleaning, fertilizing, and caring for her animals, such as pigs, hogs, and sheep, which she fattens to later sell for a higher price. She sells her products in the city where she has regular buyers, who know about her effort and the quality of her products.

She belongs to the communal bank "Puntaman puririsum Sachamarca," which means "We go forward Sachamarca" (Sachamarca is the name of a local stream). This is her sixth loan from MFP, and she very much likes the work that she does in her group, because at every meeting she learns new ideas for her crops, since everyone helps each other and cooperates. For this reason, she promises to be punctual in her payments.

Sonia will invest the money she is applying for in the purchase of 200 sacks of natural fertilizer for her plantings of potatoes.

loans.use: to buy 200 sacks of natural fertilizer for her plantings of potatoes.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn of Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur has been raising pigs for more than eight years and earns 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month. She’s 27 years old now and continues to hang on with her piggery livelihood to support her two children. She been a member of GDMPC since 2009. In order to enhance her livestock for selling, Analyn borrowed 7,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase feeding supplies. Analyn hopes that someday her children will be successful in their careers.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies

loans.name: Oscar Fernando

texts.es: El Sr. Oscar tiene la edad de 34 años, casado, habita en Santo Domingo Chontales, junto a sus esposa han procreado dos hijos, uno de 12 y el otro de 4, el primero estudia su educación primaria, la esposa es ama de casa ayuda en los quehaceres del hogar son una familia trabajadora y muy unidas; don Oscar trabaja en su finca ubicada en la comarca el salto, de donde obtiene sus ingresos, solicita la ayuda de kiva para poder realizar mejoras al corral que tiene en su finca, por lo que con este préstamo comprara materiales de construcción, madera y pagara la mano de obra de las mejora que realice en su Finca. Su mayor propósito es mantener su Finca en buenas condiciones y que a su familia no le falte el pan de cada día, sueña con ver sus hijos preparados.
texts.en: Señor Oscar is 34 years old and married. He lives in Santo Domingo Chontales, along with his wife. They have two children, one 12 and the other 4 years old. The older one is in primary school. His wife is a homemaker. He helps with the household tasks. They are a hardworking family and very united. Don Oscar works on his farm in the El Salto district, from which he obtains his income. He is applying for Kiva's help to be able to make improvements in the corral which he has on his farm, and so with this loan he will buy construction materials and wood and pay for labor for the improvements that he will make on his farm. His greatest goals are to keep his farm in good condition and that his family not lack for daily bread. He dreams of seeing his children educated.

loans.use: to improve his farm.

loans.name: Narin's Group

texts.en:
Narin, 19, is married and lives with her family in a village of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. She has one daughter under her care. To earn a living, she has been farming rice and her husband has been supplementing the family’s income by working as a paid worker for one year. The current business earns her family about 20,000 KHR per day. Low crop yields resulted from flooding is still the main challenge for her business.
 
There are three members in Narin’s group and they are the first cycle of client with VisionFund. Narin, who is the leader, is leading her group to ask for a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland, and use a portion of it to spend for plowing and harvesting. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from the current business so as to live with a better standard of life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en: Elmer is a 44-year-old farmer from the village of Burgos province of Isabela. He is married and lives with his wife and two school-aged children. The only source of income for the family is agriculture. The family has a 4-hectare plot of land. The family sells harvested crops to the local market. The total average monthly income of the family is around 5,000 PHP. Elmer requested PHP 30,000 credit for renting a tractor for land cultivation and for purchasing seeds. After proper cultivation and sowing quality seeds, the family will get a good harvest in the summer season. They will sell it for a good price and get their planned income. The family hopes that the increased income will allow them to save for house renovations, in order to fix up their old house and create better living conditions.

loans.use: to rent a tractor and purchase seeds for his farming business.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en: Danilo is engaged in agriculture. He would like to increase his production and develop his farm. This would help him to cover his family's daily costs and also save for his children's education in the future. Danilo lives together with his wife and children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm business.

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es: Ana empezó su venta de víveres por la necesidad de ser útil en mi vida e independiente a fin de darle a su hijo una mejor condición de vida y enseñarle la responsabilidad. El negocio está ubicado en la sala de casa en Quevedo ya que de esta manera puede cuidar de su hijo quien tiene unos meses de nacido. El esposo fue quien le ayudo con el capital ya que es policía y al ver sus ganas de ayudarle la apoyo, el trabajo lo realiza sola a veces le ayuda su madre. En su tienda vende producto de venta diaria como arroz, azúcar, aceite, granos, enlatados etc. Obteniendo buenas utilidades. El préstamo que está solicitando lo empleara en la compra de mercadería para la venta esperando poder aumentar sus ventas ya que su sueño es permanecer junto a su familia y crecer como empresa.
texts.en: Ana began her sale of groceries out of the need to be useful in her life and independent, with the goal of giving her son better living conditions and teaching him responsibility. The business is located in the living room of her house in Quevedo, since this way she can care for her son, who is a few months old. Her husband helped her with the capital since he is a policeman, and on seeing her eagerness to help him, he supported her. She works alone, and at times her mother helps her. In her store she sells products of daily use such as rice, sugar, oil, grains, canned food, etc. She is obtaining good earnings. She will use the loan that she is applying for to buy merchandise to sell, hoping to increase her sales, since her dream is to remain with her family and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, grains, and canned food.

loans.name: Hedeliza

texts.en:
Hedeliza is from Taguitic, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte. She is 53 years old. Hedeliza is married and has four children. To make a living, she manages a fishpond where she raises fish, crabs and shrimp for sale. She has been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns 18,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from this activity. 

In 2008, Hedeliza joined GDMPC. Hedeliza is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to buy young fish to raise and twine to expand the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy young fish to raise and twine to expand the business

loans.name: Melchor

texts.en: Melchor, 43 years old, is a widower with one grown-up child. Melchor is engaged in a farming business with the help of his son. According to him, he does everything for his son because he promised his wife that he would take good care of him. That's why he works hard to help his son achieve his dreams. Melchor is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and seeds for his farm. Melchor hopes that he can give his son everything he needs.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farm business.

loans.name: Progreso Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PROGRESO” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Tejada, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lucia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: cría de animales, cultivo de verduras, cría y venta de animales.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lucia es una integrante, ella indica que es hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de cría de animales; da a que este negocio lo adquirió de sus padres desde niña y en la actualidad ella realiza este emprendimiento para su subsistencia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de alimento para ganado (compra de forraje) mismo que adquiere de las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente alimentará a su ganado. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de  salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Progreso" will start its 3rd loan cycle in the Villa Tejada central office of Pro Mujer.  This group has 9 members, and is led by a board of directors where Lucia is the president.  The members of this communal bank have a variety of businesses, including: raising animals, cultivating vegetables, and livestock production and sales.

This loan will benefit the small business people in this group where Lucia is a member.  She states that she joined Pro Mujer 3 years ago at the invitation of a loan officer who was at her house.  Now she has a business raising animals; she acquired the business from her parents, who had it from the time she was a child.  Now she runs the business to support herself.

The loan that she will take now will be used to buy food for her cattle (fodder), which she will buy in the markets in the city of El Alto and later feed to her cattle.  This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family as much as she can, as she is married and has 3 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes the health services.

loans.use: to buy feed for her cattle (fodder)

loans.name: Darly Antonia

texts.es: Darly Antonia de 39 años de edad, habitante de la comarca Kajinicuil, tiene tres hijos de 19. 17 y 9 años de edad respectivamente quienres estudian y le ayudan a los quehaceres en la finca, se dedica a siembra de tuberculos, comercializan ganado y leche.  la señora Darly es muy trabajadora, ha luchado por sacar adelante a sus hijos para que sean personas de bien, requiere su primer credito el cual solicita a Kiva para continuar con el negocio de ganado pues pretende comprar tres terneros para engordarlos y luego comercializarlos.  El proposito de esta señora es continuar trabjando y obtener mejores resultado en su negocio Ganadero para que a su Familia que es muy unida no le falte el pan de cada dia.
texts.en:
Darly Antonia is 39 years old and a resident of Kajinicuil district. She has three children ages 19, 17, and 9 years respectively who are in school and help her out with the farm chores. She works growing tuber vegetables and selling cattle and milk. Darly is very hardworking; she has fought to get her children ahead so that they can be better people. 

She needs her first loan that she is requesting from Kiva so she can continue with her cattle business; then, she can try to buy three calves to fatten them and later sell them. Her aim is to keep working and get better results in her cattle business, so that her family, which is very close, will not lack their daily bread.

loans.use: to purchase calves to raise.

loans.name: Banco Comunal El Milagro Group

texts.es: Banco Comunal El milagro esta conformado por  9 intregrantes los cuales se unieron para tener una herramienta de trabajo propia y poder aportar economicamente con los gastos del hogar, las ingrantes son:  Aydalina, Alba Rosa, Adelayda, Candida, Alba Lidia, Teofila, Danelia, Maria Josefa, Esmeralda , Teofila es la cordinadora del banco la cual se encarga de la responsabilidad, y union de cada integrantes del banco, todas tiene diferentes actividades econimicas , Teofila tiene por actividad  una venta de fritanga ubicada en su casa de habitacion la cual se elabora: gallo pinto, maduro con cuajada, tacos, enchiladas,carne asada, tajadas, pollo frito, manuelitas,
texts.en: The communal bank "El Milagro" has 9 members who united to support their businesses so that they could contribute financially to the expenditures of their households.  The members are:  Aydalina, Alba Rosa, Adelayda, Candida, Alba Lidia, Teofila, Danelia, Maria Josefa,  and Esmeralda.   Teofila is the coordinator of the bank; she has the responsibility of organizing and united each of the members of the bank, who all have different economic activities.  Teofila has a business selling fried foods.  Her business is in her house, and she makes rice and beans, fried bananas with cheese, tacos, enchiladas, grilled steak, fried plantains, fried chicken and crepes.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make rice and beans, fried bananas with cheese, tacos, enchiladas, grilled steak, fried plantains, fried chicken and crepes

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en: Epifania is from the village of Baringin Sur. She is 57 years old and is married to Ramilindo. To make a living, Epifania has been running her sari-sari store, or variety store for seven years and she usually received a net profit of PHP 300 daily. Right now, Epifania is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 15,000 to purchase additional stocks of groceries such as canned goods, noodles, assorted bread, curls, and assorted candies to sell in her sari-sari store. Epifania hopes that she can get the amount she requested and she believes that through her strong determination she will be able to improve her family's living condition.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries such as canned goods, noodles, assorted bread, curls, and assorted candies to sell

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel, aged 36, operates a buy and sell business. He usually sells green peppers, bananas and pechays in the market with the help of his kind wife. They wish for a higher income in order to give a good life to their child.  

To earn higher profit, Joel is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase more vegetables such as cabbage and eggplant. He hopes his request will be approved in order to have a better quality of income.

loans.use: buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: VERONICA TIENE 29 AÑOS VIVE EN LA ZONA DE PASANKERI CENTRAL EN LA CASA DE SUS PADRES, DE LA CIUDAD DE LA PAZ, CUENTA CON UN NEGOCIO DE TIENDA DE BARRIO CON 3 AÑOS DE EXPERIENCIA EN EL RUBRO. LA CLIENTE CON EL TRANSCURSO DEL TIEMPO AHORRÓ DINERO DE DONDE CON ESE PEQUEÑO CAPITAL ABRIÓ LA TIENDA DE BARRIO. EL DESTINO DEL CRÉDITO ESTA DESTINADO A CAPITAL DE OPERACIÓN, COMPRA DE MERCADERÍA, CON EL DINERO SOLICITADO INCREMENTARÁ SU MERCADERÍA PARA SURTIR AÚN MÁS SU TIENDA. EL PRIMER CRÉDITO LE AYUDO PARA MEJORAR SU TIENDA INCREMENTANDO SU MERCADERÍA, EN CUANTO A SU EXPERIENCIA QUIERE AMPLIAR SU NEGOCIO Y SU NIVEL DE INGRESOS, CUENTA CON ACTITUD DE PAGO Y BUEN EMPRENDIMIENTO EN LA ADMINISTRACIÓN DE SU NEGOCIO YA QUE LA CLIENTE SOBRESALIÓ A PESAR DE CONTAR CON UN DEFECTO FÍSICO, PERDIENDO EL MIEMBRO INFERIOR DERECHO EN UN ACCIDENTE DE TRÁNSITO HACE 6 AÑOS, ES MADRE SOLTERA DE UN HIJO, Y A LA FECHA USA PRÓTESIS, MANTIENE UNA SALUD ESTABLE Y SE MOVILIZA DE FORMA NORMAL CON UN BASTÓN.
texts.en:
Veronica is 29 years old and lives in the area of central Pasankeri in the city of La Paz, in her parent's home. She has a neighborhood store and has three years of experience in this field. 

With the small savings that she saved over time, she opened a neighborhood store. The loan is intended for working capital to purchase merchandise. With the loan requested she will increase her merchandise to stock her store. Her first loan helped her to improve the store, increasing her merchandise. With her experience, she wants to expand her business and her level of income. She counts on her promptness in making payments and in her entrepreneurship in managing her grocery store business. 

She succeed even though she had a physical handicap. She lost her lower right limb in a traffic accident six years ago. She is a single mother of a son. Nowadays, she uses a prosthesis, has a stable health and can get around with a cane.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to increase the variety of her products

loans.name: Lai's Group

texts.en: Aged 39 years old, Lai is one of the breadwinners of the family residing in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has five children, three of whom are still in school. One of the other two helps the family's business and the other sells grocery items from home. Lai and her husband have planted paddy rice on seven hectares of farmland. She uses her spare time to earn additional income by selling sweets. She has been in these businesses for 25 years and is able to earn about 20,000 KHR per day. For her, low crop yields remain the main challenge to affect her income. To overcome her challenge, especially to recover the loss, she has formed a group of three female members to ask for new loan. This is the third loan cycle for Lai with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. She has successfully repaid the entire loan which has helped her to grow her rice on time and maintain her standard of living. Now she leads a group of three female members to seek for a new loan. Neang is going to use her loan portion to buy rice seed and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to gradually improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita's main source of income comes from cooking and selling "pancit" and "sopas" and other snacks in their local community. She is 50 years old and is married. They are from the village of Del Pilar. Teresita has been in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 300 Philippine pesos (PHP) a day. 

Right now, Teresita is requesting a loan of 45,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients for her "pancit" and more curls to sell. She plans to use the additional income to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her "pancit" and more curls to sell

loans.name: Roern's Group

texts.en:
Roern is a 52-year-old mother of four children living in a rural village of the Sangke district of Battambang province, Cambodia. Out of her four children, she still has three children (two daughters and one son) to take care of and all of whom are in school. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice and planting chilies and  cucumbers etc., for several years. The current business earns her about KHR30,000 per day to meet family’s needs. Low crop yield is the main challenge for her business.  

This is the eighth microloan for Roern’s group with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She has completely paid back the past loans which have helped her to support her family and she has bought plots of farmland. Now leading her group of three to apply for a loan with VisionFund, Roern, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income so as to make a better living  and keep her children in school until graduation.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase power tools, sign contracts and have working capital.

loans.name: George

texts.en: Edgardo, 52 years old, is married to Rosemarie. He lives in Burgos, Isabela province with his family. Ever since he was little, Edgardo has worked with his family growing crops such as corn and rice. He is a very hardworking person. Edgardo currently has one hectare where he grows corn and rice, which he sells at the local market. However, the buyers often come to his house. Edgardo is motivated by farming because his products are in great demand and he gets a good income. Edgardo has requested this loan of PHP 25,000 to invest in planting corn and rice and to expand into more land. He will use the loan to pay the day workers and to buy fertilizer and seeds for the crop. His plan is to improve production and to continue getting income.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en: Jonathan is 33 years old and from the village of Burgos, an area mostly engaged in agriculture. Unable to find sufficient financial means to cultivate the land, Jonathan has applied for a loan. With the help of this loan, Jonathan hopes to receive a good harvest with his next crop and to increase his income. This will allow him to save money for further development of his agricultural business and also to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed for his farming business.

loans.name: Fenumiai

texts.en:
Fenumiai is 29 years old and maried with 2 children. She runs a small business selling ice-blocks in her community and has been doing this for two years.

 Fenumiai has requested a loan to buy ice, sugar and Kool-aid and to pay for her children's school fees. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Fenumiai will continue her business to help supplement her family income.

loans.use: to buy ice, sugar and Kool-aid and to pay for her children's school fees

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en: A resident from a rural village of the Sangke district of Battambang province, Mom is a 52-year-old mother of one child. The main source of the family’s income is from selling sweets. She has been in this business for three years and earns about KHR 50,000 per day to support the family’s needs. The main challenge for her business is the lack of water for her crop yield. Mom is a seventh-time borrower with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund while her member is a third time borrower. They successfully repaid back the loans. Mom has used the past loans with success to better support the family and expend her business. Now she is leading her group to request a loan of KHR 1,400,000 each. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds to boost her crop yields and use a portion of it to purchase materials for making sweets such as fruit, sugar, rice powder etc. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase he income so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her crop yields

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra tiene 41 años, vive en la casa que heredó hace 25 años, junto a su esposo Guzmán, con quien tiene seis hijos, pero ahora sólo están con ellos cuatro.
Una de las actividades que realiza es la venta de gasolina, desde su misma vivienda, y su esposo es chofer; más su principal actividad económica es la agricultura, poseen terrenos propios que adquirieron en sus 20 años de experiencia. Sus principales sembríos constan de papa, alverja y cebada. Los fines de semana, trabajan con sus hijos, “a ellos les enseñamos el oficio de la familia, pues todos nos dedicamos a eso, desde mis antepasados”, comenta Alejandra. Ahora se encuentran preparados para la cosecha grande, donde sembrarán la mayor parte de sus extensiones. 

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Puntaman puririsum Sachamarca”, que en español significa “Adelante caminemos Sachamarca”. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP y le gusta mucho el trabajo que realiza en su grupo, pues en cada reunión aprende nuevas ideas para sus sembríos, ya que todos se ayudan y cooperan, por ello promete ser puntual en pago de sus cuotas.
Alejandra invertirá este dinero en la compra de 100 sacos de fertilizantes naturales para sus sembríos de papa, y si el dinero le alcanza pagará el trasporte de los sacos hasta el lugar de venta.
texts.en:
Alejandra is 41 years old. She lives in the house she inherited 25 years ago along with her husband, Guzmán, with whom she has six children (although only four of them live with them now).

One of the activities that she is involved in is selling gasoline from their home, and her husband is a driver; however, their principal economic activity is agriculture. They have their own fields that they have acquired during their 20 years of experience. Their main plantings consist of potatoes, peas, and barley. On the weekends, they work with their children: "We teach them the family trade. We have all worked in it, since my ancestors," explains Alejandra. Now they are ready for the big harvest, where they sow the majority of their land.

Alejandra belongs to the communal bank "Puntaman puririsum Sachamarca," which in Quechua means to "Let's go forward Sachamarca." This is her sixth loan with MFP, and she really likes the work she does in her group. In each meeting, she learns new ideas for her plantings, since everyone helps each other and cooperates. She promises to be punctual in making her payments.

Alejandra will invest this money in the purchase of 100 sacks of natural fertilizer for her potato plantings, and if there is money left over, she will pay for the transport of the sacks to the selling location.

loans.use: to purchase 100 sacks of natural fertilizer for her potato plantings, and if there is enough money left, to pay for the transport of the sacks to the sales location.

loans.name: Luciano

texts.en:
Luciano, 50 years old, is married to Flora, and they live in the community of Burgos in Isabela province. Luciano has been farming for eight years and employs two people. He grows crops, rears chickens and fattens pigs. Luciano hopes to expand his farm in the future. 

He has requested a loan of 28,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizer and seeds to grow for his farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Warren

texts.en: Warren, 30, is a single entrepreneur from Pangabuan, Tangub City. He has two children and is earning income from his transport-service business. It has been going for almost seven years now, and he earn 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month. To improve business, Warren is borrowing the amount of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit, which he just joined recently to obtain accessories and tires. Before long, he’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires.

loans.name: Leang's Group

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village of the Dambae district, Leang is a 42-year-old widow of two children. She has one daughter and one son, both of whom are dependent on her and help the family’s business. As a widowed mother, she has struggled to feed her children by farming rice and planting rubber on 1 hectare to earn additional income; she has been in these businesses for 20 years and seven years, respectively. 

With the current business, Leang is able to earn approximately 40,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day for daily expenses. 

Her group consists of three members who are all females. Now leading her group to apply for a loan with Kiva’s partner VisionFund, Leang will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion to buy rubber bowls for latex from the rubber trees. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is married with four children. Erlinda is 61 years of age and presently lives at San Isidro Mahayag. 

Erlinda is a farmer. She has been doing this for 50 years to earn a living. She has requested a loan of 50,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase farm inputs for her farm. 

Erlinda has been a member of Paglaum MPC for almost five years in the cooperative. In the future, she hopes to earn money to support her farm inputs and farm outlay.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for her farm.

loans.name: Rat's Group

texts.en:
Rat is 29 years old and lives in a rural area of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is married and blessed with two daughters, both of whom are in her care. She has been farming rice and planting cassava for 10 years to make a living. The current business earns her about KHR20,000 per day and allows her to save about KHR10,000 each day.

Rat is a client in the third loan cycle, while the other member is just in her first loan cycle with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is leading the group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. Rat will use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland, and use a portion of it to pay for plowing. She hopes to make more crop yields and sell for a good price so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en: Janeth is married and has 2 children. She is 24 years old and resides in D'ban, Calamba. Janeth is operating a crops venture, planting and harvesting coconuts and bananas for sale in the local community to earn a living.  She has been 2 years in this business. Each month, she earns PHP 4,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This year, Janeth joined GDMPC. In the future, Janeth wants to save as a reserve for future emergencies and to purchase another farm land.

loans.use: buy fertilizer

loans.name: Orlando Antonio

texts.es: Don Orlando es casado, su esposa labora para el Hospital Asuncion de Juigalpa, en cambio él trabaja para la municipalidad como responsable de sanidad pública desde hace mas de 6 años. Esta solicitando su 3er credito con el objetivo de continuar mejorando su vivienda, el cual prentende repellar las paredes de un baño y cambiar una parte del techo que tiene en mal estado y caen goteras por dentro de la casa, por lo que esto le servira de mucho a su familia. cabe señalar que con el credito anterior logro cambiar una parte del techo de su casa y construir un sumidero. Sueña con poder brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Orlando is married. His wife works for the "Asuncion de Juigalpa" Hospital, and Orlando has worked for the city as the public health manager for more than six years. 

He is requesting his third loan with the goal of continuing to improve his residence. He plans to plaster the walls of a bathroom and replace a part of the roof that is in bad shape and leaks inside the house, so this will really help his family. 

It's worth noting that with the previous loan, Orlando managed to replace part of the roof of his house and construct a drain. He dreams of being able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to plaster his bathroom and replace the roof.

loans.name: 27 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “27 DE MAYO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Fidelia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de ropa, venta de chocolate, venta de banderas, venta de ropa para niños, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Fidelia es una integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su hija que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa; da a conocer que  este emprendimiento fue adquirido hace años, pues ella vendía ropa usada, cambiando el producto a ropa nueva que comercializa con el apoyo de su hija.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de mercadería (compra de tela) mismo que adquirirá de la frontera de Bolivia y Perú y posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de  capacitación.
texts.en:
The “27 de Mayo" communal bank will start its first loan cycle in Pro Mujer, through the Santiago ll regional office. It is made up of eight members and is led by a board of directors of which Fidelia is the chairperson. The businesses that the members of the group carry on are varied. They include selling clothing, chocolate, flags, children's clothing and food.

The loan they will take out will benefit the owners of small businesses, including Fidelia. She says this is the first time she been a part of Pro Mujer, and she joined at the invitation of her daughter, who is a member of the institution. 

 
At the present time, she has a business selling clothing. She indicates that this enterprise was acquired years ago, and that she sold used clothing, later changing the product to new clothing, which she sells with her daughter's help.
 
The loan she will take out now is to purchase merchandise such as fabric, which she will acquire from the border of Bolivia and Peru, and later sell in the markets in the city of El Alto. This form of work allows her to generate resources for supporting her family as much as possible, as she is single and has a child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training area.

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
This is Luzviminda, 47, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. Her husband is Silverio, a carpenter, and a father to her two children. She, together with her husband manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.            
                 
Luzviminda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Luzviminda hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
This is Imelda, 50, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to George. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Imelda maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through direct sales brands like Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct sales brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealers' prices are lower than those in the catalogue, which is how they earn an income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php1,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue her business, she is requesting a Php 25,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Imelda fervently hopes that her children will be able to graduate one day. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise needed in her business

loans.name: Leona

texts.en:
This is Leona, 47, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is a mother to her two children. She manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.
