She and her member are applying for KHR 200,000 each. Ai is going to use her portion to build a proper toilet. She hopes to maintain good hygiene for her family so she can pay more attention to making more income to sustain her standard of living.

loans.use: To build a proper toilet

loans.name: Simeon

texts.en:
Simeon is 42 years old married and blessed with four children. He runs a tailoring business in Eldama Ravine town and this has been his income generating business for the last six years, where he gets an average monthly income of KES. 33,000. 

He has borrowed a second loan of KES. 40,000 after successfully paying his previous loan. With this loan he intends to purchase sewing materials and other textiles for clothes making. He anticipates to get profits which he will use to expand his business.

Simeon hopes to improve his living standards and save money to enable him to pay school fees for his children as well as start another business.

loans.use: To purchase sewing materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy palm kernels in bulk

loans.name: Bibioy

texts.en: Bibioy is married but does not have any children. Her husband went to a foreign country to find a job. She always wanted to provide her family with a good quality of life, that’s why she decided to start a new business with animal husbandry in order to generate an income with which she can contribute to her home’s finances. She sews national dresses but has few clients and small income.  If you help her with money, she would buy sheep. She studied, taking the course of ‘To get success’, offered by a women organization to get enough skills about business. She will be a very successful business woman as she is hardworking and smart. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 TJS to buy cattle to start her new business. She will succeed using the loan and her business will become a source of income, so that her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle to start a new business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase palm kernels in bulk

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en:
A group member Nazia tells her story that she has 2 daughters. eldest one is studying in 1st grade while her youngest daughter is not of school going age yet.
Her husband is a driver by profession and provide transport services. his income is not enough that's why Nazia started sewing few years ago. Her work quality has improved with the passage of time and now she receives regular orders every month.
She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for purchasing clothes in bulk quantity. she will sew them and will sell on profits to her clients.

loans.use: To buy cloth for a sewn clothes selling business

loans.name: Nyamulagir Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mapendo est enseignante (monitrice) dans une école primaire, qui  bénéficie des crédits de l’IMF Hekima. Elle est aussi ménagère. Elle est  âgée de 32 ans, mariée et mère de 4 jeunes enfants. Son crédit sera affecté dans le projet d’habitat.  Elle vient de réaliser 2 cycles dans le programme de Hekima. Avec ce nouveau cycle de crédit, elle va acheter  25 tôles, 100 planches, clous, etc. pour la réalisation du projet de construction de sa maison. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son programme  de microcrédit aux enseignants.
texts.en:
Mapendo, age 32, is a teacher (monitor) in a primary school. She is also a homemaker. She is a married mother of four young children. 

Mapendo is a member of the Hekima MFI, and she has previously completed two loan cycles. Her new loan will be used for a housing project, and she will use the funds to buy 25 pieces of sheet metal, 100 boards, some nails, etc. needed to build her house.  

Mapendo wishes to thank the Hekima MFI for its microfinance program for teachers.

loans.use: to buy 25 pieces of sheet metal, 100 boards, some nails, etc.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua is married and has three children. She has no formal education. Akua sells banku (a dough made from maize and cassava) in Watreso, near Abura, which she has done for five years. Her husband is a teacher. Akua uses her income to pay her children's school fees.

Akua will use the loan to purchase maize and cassava in bulk. With her new profits, Akua plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize and cassava in bulk

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik lives in Agarak town with her husband, two-year-old little daughter and pensioner grandmother. Hasmik's husband works at the local military unit. He is also involved in agriculture together with his wife. They raise pigs and grow fruit trees.

Hasmik would like to develop pig breeding, for which she has applied for this loan. With the requested amount, she will purchase one mother pig and 17 young pigs. This will allow Hasmik to gather more income from agriculture and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for pigs and forage (feed)

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 

Elsie buys and sells vegetables in their village. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for 4,000 PHP to buy more vegetables to resell like squash and beans.

Elsie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Elsie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to resell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah sells secondhand clothing in Watreso, near Abura. Sarah has received education through high school.  She is married to a driver and has three children.

Sarah has been selling secondhand clothing for six years. She is responsible for paying her children's school fees. Her loan will be used to buy clothing in bulk. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk

loans.name: Aimons-Nous 1 Group

texts.en:
Berthe, age 35, is a single mother of a 5 year old. Her mother lives with her and the child as well. She is representing the Aimons Nous 1 group.

Berthe owns a butcher shop and has been operating this business for a year. She will use the loan to buy an assortment of meats to sell in her shop. Her business strategy is to give friendly customer service and to offer competitive prices relative to the market prices.

Berthe has received 4 previous loans from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo. She has a good repayment record.

loans.use: to pay for assorted meats

loans.name: Letasuma

texts.en:
Letasuma is 35 years old. He is married to Nataana and they are blessed with two children, age 7 and 2 years.

He has been in the animal-sales business for two years and he earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. This is his second KADET loan, which he will use to purchase more animals to sell. 

The profit he earns will be used to educate his children and also to create a job for his wife, who is not working for now. He hopes to have a better future  for his family.

loans.use: To purchase more animals for sale.

loans.name: Lutfiya

texts.en:
Lutfiya is a hardworking person. She is a widow and has two sons. 

After her husband's death she had a very difficult living condition. She worked hard to comfort her little children with all necessary things. Little by little with the passing of the time she has perfected her knowledge, and now she has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 11 years.

Thanks to the good condition of her animals, she has managed to win a large quantity of customers for her business. She sells her animals in the local market and has many customers. 

Lutfiya is looking for a loan to buy young cattle. In this way she will be able to offer her customers good animals and continue to make financial progress, providing her household with good earnings. Moreover, in this way she will be able to offer her son access to a better quality education and a financial stability that will allow him to progress. 

She is asking for a loan of 10,000 TJS to buy young cattle for developing the business further. Each month she will make her payments on time. She awaits your help and mercy.

loans.use: To buy cattle for developing her business.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children.
 
Imelda buys and sells fruits and spices. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy more spices and fruits to resell.

Imelda is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Imelda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more spices and fruits to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fish in bulk.

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. 

Florida has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She had this business for 21 years. 

She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Florida  has been a member of HSPFI since 2006. In the future, Florida hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase ingredients and clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Shirley Margoth

texts.es:
Shirley Margoth tiene 31 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los dos hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUCHANDO POR UNA MISMA CAUSA, se encuentra ubicada en el en el Recinto La primavera, perteneciente al Canton Ventans, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Shirley Margoth se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz  y frejol. Las compras lo hace en la ciudad de ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, comprar semillas, insumos, urea, fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es hacer la casa más grande.

En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer la limpieza en la casa y le gusta escuchar musica.
texts.en:
Shirley Margoth is 31 years old. She is married, and she lives with her husband and their two children in the Ventanas canton, Los Ríos province.

The members of the “Luchando Por Una Misma Causa” (Fighting for the Same Cause) communal bank are in the La Primavera neighborhood in the Ventanas canton. This communal bank devotes itself to growing short cycle corn and rice.

Shirley grows corn, rice, and beans. She makes her purchases in the city of  Ventanas.

She is requesting the loan to plant corn and rice. She will buy seeds, supplies, urea, and fertilizers for her crops. The support from the loan will help to financially meet her needs.

Her dream is to make her house bigger.

In her free time she likes to clean the house, and she likes to listen to music.

loans.use: to plant corn and rice and to buy seeds, supplies, urea, and fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Mashoida

texts.en:
Mashoida is a 31-year-old woman. She is married but has not any child. Her husband is a kind man who went to a foreign country to find a job and can’t help his wife, and that’s why Mashoida must manage alone. 

She managed with animal husbandry but the fast development of the modern world makes her more progressive. That’s why she is going to begin a new business of sewing national women's dresses. She studied at the course of "To Get a Success" at the women's organization and got enough skills to organize the new business. She will work in her own workshop in the centre of her town. She will be a good business woman as she is clever and industrious. 

She wants to organize her business but she needs to buy a new sewing machine and fabrics. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 TJS to buy a sewing machine and fabrics. She promises to make her payments on time. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and fabrics.

loans.name: Somnang's Group

texts.en:
Somnang is originally from a rural area of the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal Province, Cambodia. She is 33 years old and a mother of five dependent children, two daughters and three sons, all of whom are still in school. 

To support the studies for her five children as well as the daily basic needs of this big household, Somnang runs a mobile stall for selling fish, pork and vegetables. To help her, her husband also earns extra income working as a construction worker. Together, they are able to earn about 13,000 KHR per day. 

Somnang's group consists of eight members; all members including her are first-time borrowers with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. As the group leader, she is going to use her portion to buy a latrine slab and necessary materials for constructing an above-the-ground shelter for a toilet such as roof, brick, cement, door, etc. She hopes that her children can access a decent and clean toilet for improving good hygiene.

loans.use: To build a decent toilet.

loans.name: Abdalla

texts.en:
Abdalla is 35 years old and is a boda boda (motorcycle) operator, operating in his rural community. He is married and has three children, and he has been in this business for the last two years. His business is doing great.

This marks Abdalla's second borrowing from Yehu to finance his business. He plans to purchase spare parts to service his motorcycle. He will use the anticipated profits to open a kiosk. He hopes to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is married and has five children. She has received schooling through high school. Joyce sells onions in Watreso, near Abura, which she has done for three years. Her husband is an operator. Joyce uses her income to pay her children's school fees. Joyce will use the loan to purchase onions in bulk. With the new profits from her expanded business, Joyce plans to finance her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase onions in bulk.

loans.name: Aimons-Nous 2 Group

texts.en:
Telesphore, age 42, is married and has two children, 9 and 12 years old. He also cares for his elderly father. 

He is representing the Aimons Nous 2 group. Telesphore owns and operates a barber shop, and has been doing this for six years. He will use the loan to pay for electric hair clippers, chairs, and a small generator. 

His greatest difficulty is the unstable electricity in his community. When he purchases the small generator, he will be able to continue to operate even when the electricity stops. 

His business strategies are to offer friendly customer service, create an inviting atmosphere in his shop and sterilize all his materials.
 
Telesphore has received three previous loans from HOPE Congo. He has a good repayment record. He hopes to continue to grow and own a large salon one day.

loans.use: to pay for hair clippers, chairs, and a small generator.

loans.name: Salomat

texts.en: Salomat is an entrepreneur who is married and has a son, 6, and a daughter, 17. She has been busy with animal husbandry more than six years. Little by little, with the passing of time, she has perfected her knowledge. Thanks to the animals' good condition, she has managed to win a large quantity of customers for her business. She sells her animals in the local market. Salomat is looking for a loan to buy young cattle. In this way she will be able to offer her customers good animals and continue to make financial progress, providing her household with good earnings. Moreover, in this way she will be able to offer her son access to a better quality education and a financial stability that will allow him to progress. She is going to buy furniture for her daughter from the profits. Each month she will make her payments on time. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle for developing her business.

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en: Sobia is a young, energetic person and has been in the beauty parlor business for the past eight years. Her father is a retired gardener. She has two brothers and two sisters. She works for the improvement of her family finances and she has helped her sister and brother-in-law through her beauty parlor business. She has gradually improved her parlor with the help of Kashf loans and now she is in need of Rs. 35,000 so that she could purchase new items and equipment for her beauty parlor which will help advance her parlor and hence better support her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items and equipment for her beauty parlor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish in bulk.

loans.name: Prudence 1 Group

texts.en:
Leonie, age 42, is a single mother of three children, ages 15 to 23. She also cares for her elderly father. She is representing the Prudence 1 group. Leonie has a small business selling yogurt and other food items at a stand in the market. She has been operating this business for three years. She will use the loan to buy flour, sugar, and milk. Her business strategy is to be friendly and helpful to all of her customers. 
This is Leonie's first loan from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo. Her group and HOPE trust that she is a good business owner and will repay the loan. In the future, she hopes to travel abroad to buy clothing and then sell it back in Brazzaville.

loans.use: to pay for milk, sugar, and flour.

loans.name: Noel De Jesús

texts.es: Noel de Jesús vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos, él se dedica  al cultivo de maíz y tiene muchos años de trabajar en la agricultura se ha hecho de experiencia que le permite mejorar su labor día con día y así obtener siempre buenas cosechas, el terreno de cultivo esta ubicado en una zona apta para la siembra y cercano a donde vive, comercia en todas las zonas aledañas a la localidad y tiene mucha clientela pues lo prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan a precios realmente accesibles además el servicio es excelente siempre esta a la orden de las personas; Noel es un hombre decidido, trabajador, responsable pero sobre todo muy motivado a salir adelante y alcanzar sus sueños, quiere llegar al éxito y su mas grade secreto es la perseverancia, en esta temporada de siembra quiere aumentar la producción pero necesita de capital para lograrlo es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, abono, insecticida, herramientas, etc. Noel de Jesús tiene buenas referencias de pago y con una moral intachable, asegura cancelar la deuda y a la vez darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Noel de Jesús lives with his life partner and their children.  He grows corn, and he has been working in agriculture for many years.  This has given him experience, which allows him to improve his work day by day.  This way he always gets good harvests.

His land is located in an area that is suitable for sowing, and it is close to where he lives.  He sells in all of the nearby areas.  He has a lot of customers.  They prefer him because he always has what they need at very accessible prices.  Also, his service is excellent, and he is always at his customers’ disposal.

Noel is a determined, hard-working, and responsible person.  He is, above all, very motivated to get ahead and achieve his dreams.  He wants to be successful, and his biggest secret is perseverance.  

During this planting season he wants to increase the production.  However, he needs capital to do so.  That is why he is requesting a loan from Integral.  The loan will allow him to buy corn seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, and tools, etc.  Noel de Jesús has good payment references and high moral character.   He affirms that he will repay the loan, and he will give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, and tools.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Ms Shakeela is divorced and has no children. She now lives with her parents. Her father supplies water to houses. She lives in a community that does not accept divorced females and is hard to come by for females. However, she does not lose hope and started sewing and meeting her expenses. 

Shakeela has been in this business for four years and it’s her second year with Kashf. She gradually improved her business but still needs to buy a better sewing machine and raw materials including needles, buttons, zippers, and thread for the purpose of stitching. In this way she will flourish in her business or become self sufficient; this will cost her 30,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR).

loans.use: to buy a better sewing machine and raw materials including needles, buttons, zippers, and thread for the purpose of stitching.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora  Mercedes, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Ahorro es progreso” del distrito de Saylla de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. La socia  está casada y es madre de 4 niños,  Mercedes se sigue dedicando a la crianza y  comercio de animales menores mayormente de gallinas, las cuales comercializa en los diferentes restaurantes de su distrito. Mercedes trabaja criando animales menores hace algunos años y es con esta actividad que mantiene su hogar y a sus hijos, apoyando  a su esposo que se dedica a otras actividades. La socia en esta oportunidad invertirá su préstamo para capitalizar su actividad y comprará más gallinas.
Mercedes está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle educar a sus hijos y por ayudarla a mantenerse y desarrollarse con su actividad.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a member of “Ahorro es progreso” (Saving is Progress), a Communal Bank of Saylla, a district of the town of Cusco, Peru. She is married and she has 4 children, and she keeps on engaging in breeding small animals, particularly chickens, selling them to the different restaurants of her district. Mercedes has been engaging in breeding small animals for a few years, and thanks to this activity she can provide for her household and her children, supporting her husband who works in a different line of business. In this occasion she will use the loan she has requested to capitalize her activity by buying more chickens.

Mercedes is deeply grateful to KIVA for allowing her to give an education to her children and for helping her supporting herself and developing her activity.

loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 48 years old, married to Salina, and blessed with nine children ages 7 to 23 years. He owns a wholesale store of weaved baskets and mats. He started this business 12 years ago and earns a monthly income of 15,000 Kenya shillings (KES). 

He wants to purchase more baskets, mats, and brooms for resale and has requested a third loan of 40,000 KES. The anticipated profit will help him purchase additional stock for his business.

His dream is to see his business grow and to give the best education to his children.

loans.use: to purchase weaved mats, baskets, and brooms for resale.

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Marleni, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Ahorro es progreso” del distrito de Saylla de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. La socia es una joven empresaria madre de dos hijos en edad escolar, la socia se sigue dedicando a su tienda de abarrotes la cual ha crecido mucho y además de ello, ahora también tiene un restaurante donde vende principalmente chicharrones de cerdo, y es con estas actividades que ha sabido sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos, el mayor  actualmente está preparándose para ingresar a la universidad, Marleni en esta oportunidad invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar mercadería como cerveza y carne de cerdo para sus comercios. 
Marleni trabaja mucho y se sacrifica porque quiere ver a su hijos estudiando en la universidad y por ellos está haciendo todo este sacrificio.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, una mejor educación a sus hijos y por ayudarla con el crecimiento y fortalecimiento de sus actividades.
texts.en:
Marleni is a member of “Ahorrro es progreso” (Saving is Progress), a Communal Bank of Saylla, a district of the town of Cusco, Peru. Marleni has two children who go to school; she is a young entrepreneur and she keeps on running her general store, which has notably grown; on top of this she now runs a restaurant as well, where she mainly sells pork cracklings. Thanks to these two activities she has succeeded in providing for her 2 children, the eldest of whom is currently studying to enter university. In this occasion Marleni will invest the loan she has requested in the purchase of products such as beer and pork meat for her activities.
Marleni works very hard and she makes sacrifices because she wants to see her children attend university, and it is for them she is making all these sacrifices.
She is deeply grateful to KIVA for allowing her to offer a better standard of living to her family and a better education to her children, and for helping her in strengthening her activities and in making them grow.

loans.use: To buy beer and pork meat.

loans.name: María Alejandra De La Cruz

texts.es: María Alejandra de cuarenta y nueve años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos, ella se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en el rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia valiosa que le permite mejorar en su labor para obtener siempre las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo es apto para la siembra y ubicado en una zona cercana a su vivienda, comercia en todos los lugares aledaños a la comunidad y tiene mucha clientela que la prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que  necesitan a precios bajos, además se caracteriza por su gran amabilidad y buen servicio; María es una mujer ejemplar, trabajadora siempre con un gran entusiasmo de salir adelante, su mas grande secreto es la motivación y perseverancia, esta segura que solo así alcanzara el éxito, en esta época de siembra quiere aumentar su producción pero necesita comprar insumos por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, herbicida, abono, herramienta, etc. María Alejandra tiene buenas referencias de pago es responsable y con una moral intachable asegura que podrá saldar su deuda y a la vez ofrecerle a su grupo familiar una vida mejor.
texts.en:
María Alejandra, age 49, lives with her life partner and their children.  She grows corn and beans. She has several years of valuable experience in the field.  This allows her to improve her work in order to always get the best harvests.

Her land is suitable for sowing, and it is in an area that is close to her home.  She sells in all of the areas close to her community.  She has a lot of customers, and they prefer her.  She is known for her great kindness and good service.   María is an exemplary and hard-working woman.   She is always very enthusiastic about getting ahead.  Her biggest secret is motivation and perseverance.  She is sure this is the only way to achieve success.

During this planting season she wants to increase the production.  However, she needs to buy supplies.  That is why she is requesting a loan from Integral.  The loan will allow her to buy corn and bean seeds, herbicide, fertilizer, and tools, etc.  María Alejandra has good payment references and high moral character.   She affirms that she will repay the loan, and she will give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy corn and bean seeds, herbicide, fertilizer, and tools, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more provisions in bulk

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is divorced and has 5 children. She has always wanted to provide them with a good education, and since her husband's income is not enough to provide the family with a good quality of life, Mwanasiti decided to start working about 3 years ago, selling fish, in order to generate an income with which she can contribute to her home's finances. 

Thanks to the increasing number of customers, Mwanasiti is looking for a loan to buy more fish that will allow her to increase her sales and offer better service to her customers. In this way she will get through, using her own assets, and her business will continue to be a source of income, so that her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress.

loans.use: to buy more fish.

loans.name: Frank

texts.en: Frank sells canopies and plastic chairs in Abreshia, near Elmina. Frank has received education through Junior High School.  He is married to a petty trader and has five children. Frank has been selling canopies and plastic chairs for four years. He is responsible for paying household expenses such as utility bills and for feeding and clothing his family, as well as paying for his children's school fees. His loan will be used to buy more plastic chairs. He hopes to use the new profits to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy more plastic chairs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more plastic bowls in bulk.

loans.name: Zilola

texts.en:
Zilola is married and has 3 children. She always wanted to provide them with a good education, and since her husband’s income is not enough to provide the family with a good quality of life, she decided to start a new business with a computer service in order to generate an income with which she can contribute to her home’s finances. She now works at a sewing workshop and has a small salary.  

If you will help her with money she would buy a computer. She studied the course ‘To Get a Success’ through a woman's organization and got enough skills about business.  Her children will help her with the business. She will be a very successful business woman as she is hardworking and smart. 

She is asking for a loan of 600 USD for organizing her new business. She will get through, using the loan, and her business will become a source of income so that her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a computer.

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is 26 years old, married to Leonard, and blessed with a two-year-old child. She sells cereals, a business she has been doing for the past two years and earns a monthly income of about KES 3,000. 

She wants to purchase five bags of maize and has requested for a first loan of KES 15,000. The profit from this business will help her repay her loan and expand her business. 

Her dream is to prosper in her business and purchase a piece of land to settle on with her family.

loans.use: To purchase five bags of maize for resale.

loans.name: María Edis

texts.es: María Edis de cuarenta y seis años de edad vive junto a sus dos hijos, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y a la venta de arroz, tiene varios años de manejar este negocio y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en el rubro que le permite obtener resultados valiosos en sus cosechas,  el terreno de cultivo tiene buen acceso, cercano a la carretera y es un suelo fértil para la siembra, comercia en todas las zonas cercanas a la comunidad y tiene muchos clientes que la prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan a precios accesibles además se caracteriza por un servicio inigualable; María es una mujer dedicada a su labor, motivada, decidida pero sobre todo responsable, sus tesoros mas valiosos son su familia y el trabajo por eso siempre se esfuerza por alcanzar el éxito, en la ultima cosecha tuvo perdidas debido al mal clima y ahora en esta época de siembra quiere recuperarse y aumentar la producción pero necesita de capital que la respalde por eso se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, arroz, herbicida, insecticida, abono, etc. María Edis tiene buenas referencias de pago y buena moral asegura cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: María Edis is 46 years old and lives with her two children. She cultivates corn and sells rice. She has several years of running this business and has gained a lot of experience in this area, which has allowed her to obtain valuable results from her harvests. Her fields are easily accessible and near to the highway and it has fertile soil good for planting. She conducts business in all the zones close to her community and has many clients who prefer her because she has what they need at reasonable prices as well as having an unequaled service. María is dedicated to her work, motivated and decisive, but above all, responsible. Her most valuable treasures are her family and her work, which is why she always strives for success. In her last harvest she experienced losses last year because of the bad weather but now is the time for sowing and she wants to recover and increase her production but she needs the capital to back her up. It is because of this she is asking for a loan from INTEGRAL, which will allow her to purchase corn seeds, rice, herbicide, insecticide and fertilizer, etc. María Edis has good references in regard to her payments and her moral character assures she will pay back her debt in the required amount of time while at the same time providing her family with a sense of economic stability.

loans.use: purchase corn seeds, rice, herbicide, insecticide and fertilizer.

loans.name: Arnulfo Rolando

texts.es: Arnulfo Rolando de cincuenta y dos años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite obtener buenas cosechas, el terreno de cultivo esta ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola, lugar accesible y con suelo fértil, comercia en los alrededores de la comunidad y es muy conocido pues todo lo que vende es de primera calidad y a precios realmente accesibles además se caracteriza por su gran amabilidad y su buen servicio; Arnulfo es un hombre dedicado a su trabajo, honesto, responsable pero sobre todo entregado a su familia, para el su vida es una lucha que trata de ganar día con día para llegar al éxito y se esta esforzando para lograrlo, en esta temporada de siembra quiere aumentar la producción por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar insumos como semilla de maíz, herbicidas, insecticidas, abono, etc. Arnulfo Rolando tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, tiene la certeza que podrá cancelar la deuda y a la vez llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Arnulfo Rolando is 52 years old and lives with his significant other. He cultivates corn and has several years working in the agricultural sector, which has given him the kind of experience he needs to obtain good harvests. The fields he works are located in a zone with a high incidence of agricultural work, it is accessible and has fertile soil. He has business with communities around his own and is well known because all that he sells is of the best quality and for reasonable prices. He is also known for his friendliness and his good service. Arnulfo is a man dedicated to his work, he is honest and responsible, but above all else he is dedicated to his family. For him, his life is a battle that he tries to win every day so that he can be successful and he is currently working to achieve this. Right now it is planting season and he wants to increase his production and this is why he is asking for a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow him to purchase corn seed, herbicides, insecticides, fertilizer etc. Arnulfo Rolando has good references in regards to his payments and in moral character is unquestionable, and he is sure he will be able to repay his debt while at the same time providing his family with a sense of economic security and a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase corn seeds, herbicides, insecticides and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase palm oil.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is 32 years old, married to Norah, and blessed with two children aged eight and two years respectively.  He sells clothes, a business he ventured into five years ago and earns a monthly income of about KES 5,000. 

He has requested his first loan of KES 15,000 to purchase two bales of sweaters for resale. 

The profit he earns will help him educate his children and open other lines of business. He dreams of being a millionaire in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase two bales of sweaters for resale.

loans.name: José Pascual

texts.es: José Pascual de cuarenta y ocho años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de cereales especialmente al cultivo de maíz y frijol tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite mejorar su labor y obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo esta apto para la siembra,  con suelo fértil y cercano a su vivienda, comercia  en los alrededores y tiene mucha clientela pues las personas lo prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan a precios accesibles  además el servicio es único siempre esta a la orden del día, José es un hombre emprendedor dedicado a su labor siempre dispuesto a salir adelante es responsable, honesto y motivado quiere alcanzar el éxito, en la ultima siembra tuvieron perdidas y quiere recuperarse pero necesita comprar insumos por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, abono, insecticida, etc. José Pascual tiene buenas referencias de crédito y una moral intachable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: José Pascual is 48 years old and he lives with his significant other and his children. He cultivates cereals, especially corn, as well as beans. He has been working for several years in the agricultural sector and he has gained a lot of experience which allows him to improve his work and obtain better harvests. His fields are good for planting, with fertile soil and are close to his home. He has business with the nearby communities and has many clients because people prefer to go to him because he always has what they need at reasonable prices as well as having impeccable service. José is an enterprising man dedicated to his work, always ready to get ahead, he is responsible, honest and motivated and wants to be successful. He experienced losses in his last harvest, and he wants to recuperate, but he needs to purchase supplies and this is why he is asking for a loan from INTEGRAL, which will allow him to purchase corn seed, beans, fertilizer, insecticide, etc. José Pascual has good references in regards to credit and his moral character is unquestionable, which assures he will repay his debt while at the same time offering his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase corn seed, beans, fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more provisions in bulk.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John used his previous loan to buy a cow, and it has been profitable.

This will be his fifth loan, and he plans to buy another cow and three sheep. This will enable him to increase his livestock, which he will later sell. He anticipates to make more profits with which he intends to pay school fees for his children.

In the future, John hopes to buy a vehicle for transporting his livestock to various markets to sell.

loans.use: To buy a cow and some sheep

loans.name: Ma . Gina

texts.en: Ma. Gina is a 44-year-old married woman from the community of Nocnocan, Talibon, Bohol. She operates a sari-sari store that sells different items needed by her neighbors. She is asking for a loan to buy rice, corn, soft drinks, beer, coconut wine, soap and detergent. She has five children who are still studying and need her support. Ma. Gina's income will help her husband, who is working as a fisherman, in meeting the needs of her family. In the future, she plans to make her store bigger and sell products that she did not previously carry.

loans.use: to buy rice, corn, soft drinks, beer, coconut wine, soap and detergent.

loans.name: Luka

texts.en:
Luka is 35 years old, married to Jackline, and blessed with four children aged 13, 12, eight and six years respectively.  He runs a retail shop, a business he started 13 years ago, and earns a monthly income of about KES 6,000. 

He has requested his first loan of KES 20,000 to purchase cooking fat, tissue paper, bar soap, crates of milk and bread for resale. 

The profit he earns will help him pay his children's school fees. He dreams of raising his standard of living by building a much better house.

loans.use: To purchase cooking fat, tissue paper, bar soap, crates of milk and bread.

loans.name: Ht Group

texts.en:
Mervat is the featured borrower for HT's group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. She is on the right. She has been selling shoes for 1.5 years, and does well in her business because she is a hard worker who insists on improving herself and her business, in order to please her customers as much as she can.

Mervat is only 21 years old. She applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase her business capital for a new released collection, especially summer shoes and bags highly requested by her customers. Mervat hopes to keep on expanding her business and to open a new branch in the future.

Fatima is the first from the left, she is a 20-year-old married woman, the mother of a two-year-old boy. Fatima has worked as a hairdresser for three years. Her business is at home so she can stay next to her child and take good care of her business and house at the same time. The requested loan will be invested in buying new updated hairdressing machines and tools.

Nour is the third one from the right. She is an 18-year-old single woman who wants to start her own new business. She will work as a hairdresser, and hopes to attract loyal customers.

Abir is the second from the right side, she is a 37-year-old married woman, the mother of four kids. She has worked at home selling clothes for two years, and is working hard through this loan to increase her capital.

loans.use: To increase her business capital for a new released collection of summer shoes and bags

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy liquid soap in bulk.

loans.name: Fares

texts.en:
Fares is a 26-year-old single man, living and working in Jib Jennine.   He transports fruits and vegetables from Bekaa to Beirut and Tripoli and vice versa.
Fares has been working for eight years in this field, but in September 2009 he started his own business to improve his living. That's why he applied for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to take care of necessary maintenance for his truck.  He will invest part of it on his wedding preparations.
Fares is a hard worker, with a good reputation, liked by all of his relatives, friends and neighbors.
He hopes to expand his business through increasing his pick ups and working on expanding his working zone.

loans.use: To do necessary maintenance on his truck

loans.name: Ko-Ssou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe KO-SSOU est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans un même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de  ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La  représentante du groupe, du nom de Suzanne est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Suzanne est âgée de 36 ans. Suzanne est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Marcel. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants, Suzanne vend du pain et du haricot préparé depuis cinq ans dans son quartier. Suzanne s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Suzanne sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe KO-SSOU, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The group KO-SSOU is comprised of three persons who reside in the same district. This is the first time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to boost business. The group's representative, Suzanne, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 36 years old and married to a driver named Marcel. The couple have four children, some in school but all in their care.   

To meet her needs and those of her children, Suzanne has been selling bread and cooked beans for five years in her district. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and revenues, Suzanne is requesting, along with the other members of the group KO-SSOU, an initial loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy bread and sacks of beans

loans.name: Merci Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MERCI est composé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Marie Angèle est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Marie Angèle est âgée de 36 ans et vit au Bénin. Marie Angèle n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Marie Angèle est mariée à un certain Fiacre. Le couple a deux enfants. Afin d‘assurer ses diverses charges du ménage, Marie Angèle vend depuis quinze ans des sacs de maïs à son domicile et par le système de distribution. Marie Angèle s’approvisionne au Togo. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Marie Angèle sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MERCI, un  troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group MERCI is composed of three persons living in the same district. The group's representative, Marie Angèle, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 36 years old and lives in Benin. She did not attend school. She is married to a man named Fiacre. The couple have two children. 

To ensure the diverse household expenses are covered, Marie Angèle has been selling sacks of corn out of her home and via the distribution system for fifteen years. She gets her supplies from Togo. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and revenues, Marie Angèle is requesting, along with the other members of the group MERCI, a third loan from ALIDé. The two loan previously received were indeed repaid.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn

loans.name: Djidide-Dehou Group

texts.fr: DJIDIDE-DEHOU est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante du groupe, Béatrice (qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée 39 ans. Béatrice est mariée à un certain Saliou. Le couple a trois enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Béatrice vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la maison. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Béatrice vend des sacs de charbons de bois et divers produits depuis quinze ans à son domicile. Béatrice s'approvisionne  dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Béatrice s’associe avec les autres membres du groupe DJIDIDE-DEHOU pour consentir un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
DJIDIDE-DEHOU is a group of three persons whose members are friends belonging to the same tontine. The group's representative, Béatrice (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 39 years old. She is married to a man named Saliou. The couple have three children in school. All of the children are in their care. Béatrice lives together with her children and husband. The couple jointly ensure that the different household expenses are covered. 

To support herself, Béatrice has been selling sacks of charcoal and a variety of goods for fifteen years out of her home. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin.

With the goal of bolstering her business and satisfying customer demands, Béatrice joined with the other members of the group DJIDIDE-DEHOU to agree to a third loan from ALIDé. The first two loan were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Zora Group

texts.en:
Kawthar is the featured borrower for Zora's group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. She is the one on the left.

Kawthar is a 33-year-old married woman, and a mother of two children (Mariam, Female, 8 years; and Ali, Male, 7 years old). Kawthar has worked in selling clothes for 3 years and works hard on improving her business as much as she can, to provide her children with the best lives.

This is Kawthar's second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. Her previous loan helped a lot in improving her business and reflected positively on both her social and financial situations. Kawthar requested a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her business capital with the newly released collection.

Mona is a 47-year-old married woman and mother of three children (Fatima, female, 20; Ali, male, 18; and Zeinab, 15 years old female). She wants to start a new  business, in order to help her husband in increasing their income and covering their childrens' expenses.

Lina is a 29-year-old widow and a mother of two boys (Hachem, 9, and Mohamad, 7), whom she sacrifices her whole life just to please them by providing the best things any child would request. Lina opened a toy selling shop 6 years ago after her husband passed away, to make her living and manage her family's financial situation. She hopes to keep on providing them with the necessary needs, and to see them become important people in the future.

loans.use: to increase her business capital with the new collection.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a 32-year-old beautician, and lives with her parents and brothers. She has a beauty shop in the center of Tiribe in which she works. Patricia began working in this profession with her mother some 3 years ago in her house, and with much effort, and thanks to savings she had, she managed to prepare herself to become a professional specialist. At present, she has good experience in this profession, which helps her to advance all of her family.

Patricia comments that she has many clients, female and male. She says all of her efforts are to provide her family with the best, so that in this form, she can have a better lifestyle.

Patricia is requesting a loan to buy coloring, gel, scissors, wax, and other necessary supplies for her beauty shop. She is grateful for the opportunity Yehu Microfinance provides, because having credit will be a great help for her.

loans.use: to buy coloring, gel, scissors, wax, and other necessary supplies for her beauty shop.

loans.name: Feni

texts.en:
Mrs. Feni has been a food seller since 2009. She sells food from a stall at home. Feni is dedicated to her business, where she sells a variety of foods including dumplings and flat breads. She hopes to open a cafe in the near future. 

Feni is seeking this second loan to buy ingredients in order to ensure the happiness of her customers. The loan will enable her to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, and rice. She would like to increase the foods on display and to see her children succeed. She narrates that her monthly income has greatly increased.
Thanks to the first loan that improved her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, and rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase maize in sacks.

loans.name: Fifonsi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe FIFONSI est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Justine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Justine est âgée de 40 ans et vit au Bénin. Justine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Justine est mariée à un maçon du nom de Gilbert. Le couple a cinq enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Afin d'assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Justine vend depuis quinze ans de l’huile d'arachide et des condiments à son domicile et de manière ambulante au Bénin. Justine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Justine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe FIFONSI, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The group FIFONSI is composed of three persons living in the same district. The group's representative, Justine, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 40 years old and lives in Benin. She did not attend school. She is married to a man named Gilbert. The couple have five children, all in school and in their care. 

To ensure the diverse family expenses are covered, Justine has been selling peanut oil and condiments out of her home and door to door for fifteen years. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and revenues, Justine is requesting, along with the other members of the group FIFONSI, a loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy condiments and peanut oil

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge Alberto  de cincuenta y tres años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y sorgo, tiene varios años de trabajar en el rubro de la agricultura y se siente muy orgulloso de toda la experiencia que ha ganado la gente lo conoce porque siempre obtiene las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo esta ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola y cercano a donde reside, comercia en todos los lugares aledaños a la comunidad y las personas lo buscan porque saben que todo lo que vende es de primera calidad a precios accesibles además el servicio es único siempre esta a la orden del cliente, Jorge es un hombre luchador, siempre esta trabajando y aprovechando oportunidades que se le presentan pues sabe que solo asi podrá alcanzar el triunfo, en la cosecha anterior tuvo perdidas debido al mal clima y en esta época de siembra quiere recuperarse y aumentar la producción pero necesita de capital que lo respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, sorgo, insecticida, herramientas etc. Jorge Alberto tiene buenas referencias crediticias y asegura pagar la deuda y al mismo tiempo llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Jorge Alberto is fifty three years old, he lives with his partner and children.

He makes a living growing corn and sorghum, he has worked for many years in the field of agriculture and feels very proud of all the [working] experience he has gained. People knows him because he always gets the best harvests.

His farming land is located in a zone of high agricultural presence and it's near his house, he sells in all places near his community and people looks for him because they know everything he sells is first quality and at affordable prices, also the service is unique, he is always there for his customers needs.

Jorge is a fighter, he is always working and taking advantage of the opportunities that arise because he knows that this is the only way to reach triumph.

In his last harvest he had a loss due to bad weather and in this sowing time he wants to make up for it and increase the production, but he needs capital to back him up, that is why he requests "Integral" a loan that will allow him to buy corn seed, sorghum, insect-killer, tools etc. 

Jorge Alberto has good credit references and assures he will pay his debt and at the same time bring economic security to his homestead.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, sorghum, insect-killer, tools.

loans.name: Jesugnon Group

texts.fr: JESUGNON est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies. La représentante du groupe du nom de Cécile (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 47 ans. Cécile ne vit plus avec son mari. Cécile est mère de quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à sa charge. Cécile vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule les charges de la maison. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Cécile vend des fruits de façon ambulante et ce, depuis une dizaine d’années. Cécile s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et dans une région du Bénin. Dans le but de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses et de se faire plus de profit, Cécile sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUGNON un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
JESUGNON is a group composed of three persons who are friends. The group's representative, Cécile (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 47 years old and no longer lives with  her husband. She is the mother of four children, some in school and all in her care.  She lives alone with  her children and ensures by herself that the household expenses are covered. 

To cope with her different expenses, Cécile has been selling fruit door to door for about ten years. She gets her supplies from a market and a region in Benin.

With the goal of responding better to the requirements of her burgeoning customer base and making more profit, Cécile is requesting, along with the other members of the group JESUGNON, an initial loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Saintete Group

texts.fr: SAINTETE est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe du nom de Méssè Martine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 44 ans. Méssè Martine est mariée à un certain Yves. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a deux autres enfants à charge. Méssè Martine vit avec ses enfants. Méssè Martine a peu fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Méssè Martine mène comme activité la vente des médicaments traditionnels dans son quartier depuis une vingtaine d’années. Méssè Martine s’approvisionne dans des régions du Bénin. Dans le but de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses et de se faire plus de profit, Méssè Martine sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SAINTETE, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
SAINTETE is a group composed of three persons living in the same district. The group's representative, Méssè Martine (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 44 years old and married to a man named Yves. The couple have four children, all in school and in their care. In addition to their children, the couple have two other children to support. Méssè Martine lives with her children. She has had little schooling. 

To cope with her different expenses, Méssè Martine has had a business selling traditional medicines in her district for about twenty years. She gets her supplies from regions in Benin. 

With the goal of responding better to the requirements of her burgeoning customer base and making more profit, Méssè Martine is requesting, along with the other members of the group SAINTETE, a loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy earthenware jars to make traditional medicines

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi sells cream and salt in Abreshia, near Elmina. She is married to a driver and has three children. Esi has been selling cream and salt for five years. She is responsible for paying her childrens' school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more cream and salt. She hopes to use her new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more cream and salt

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John used his previous loan amount to buy a dairy cow and it has been profitable. Besides dairy farming, he has a retail shop from which he makes extra income thereby enabling him to provide for his family's needs.

This will be his second loan and he plans to buy more stocks of flour, rice, sugar and cooking oil for sale in his shop. With the anticipated income, he plans to pay school fees for his children.

In the future, John hopes to become one of the best farmers in the area as well as open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To add more stock of goods to his retail shop.

loans.name: Konde

texts.en:
Konde, 37, is a married man who has been working in his butcher shop for two years. His business is his only source for living and he is working hard on improving it.

Konde has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Yehu in order to expand his business by buying more meat to stock in his butcher shop. This will provide Konde with extra income that he may save for future days. But in the meantime, he will invest every penny in improving his business as much as he can.

loans.use: to buy more meat to stock in his butcher shop.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is married and has four children. She has received schooling through junior high school. Comfort sells waakye (a dish made from rice and beans) in Abreshia, near Elmina, which she has done for 10 years. Her husband is a farmer. Comfort uses her income to pay her children's school fees. Comfort will use the loan to purchase more rice and beans in bulk. With her new profits, Comfort plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more rice and beans in bulk

loans.name: Wangninan Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WANGNINAN est composé de trois personnes qui sont des parentés. La représentante de ce groupe, du nom de Élisabeth est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Élisabeth est âgée de 27 ans et est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Jean. Le couple a deux enfants dont un scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Élisabeth vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Élisabeth mène comme activité, la vente des produits cosmétiques à son domicile. Parallèlement à cette activité, Élisabeth vend divers produits (mèches, etc.). Élisabeth s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Élisabeth sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe WANGNINAN, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The group WANGNINAN is composed of three persons who are related to each other. The group's representative, Élisabeth, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 27 years old and married to a furniture maker named Jean. The couple have two children, one in school and both in their care. Élisabeth lives together with her husband and children. 

The diverse household expenses are covered by the couple. To do so, Élisabeth has been running a business selling cosmetics out of her home. Parallel to this business, she sells a variety of goods (hair extensions, etc.). She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and revenues, Élisabeth is requesting, along with the other members of the group WANGNINAN, a loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products

loans.name: Naiyanoi

texts.en:
Naiyanoi is 40 years old, married to Rimoine and has been blessed with 7 children that she supports. She has been planting beans in Narok town for the last 2 years, getting a monthly income of 40,000 KES. 

She applied for her second loan of 25,000 KES from KADET LTD and she intends to acquire farm inputs for better yields. She plans to use the anticipated profits to increase her farm acreage. Her future dream is to have a sustainable business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is 48 years old and is married with four children aged between 12 and 25 years. All of her children are in school.

Damaris is a farmer and has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to start a tailoring business, which will be her secondary business.

She hopes to have a better living standard in the near future.

loans.use: to start a tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sandals in bulk

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en: Romeo is 33 years old and live in Nocnocan, Talibon, Bohol. He is married and has five children. His eldest child is 10, and his youngest is only a one-year-old baby. Romeo hopes to improve his livelihood by asking for a loan. His loan request will be used to buy crab traps, fishing net, and more fish to resell. This will allow him to make improvements in his business and increase his income for his family's needs. It will also allow him to keep his children in school. In the future, he plans to expand his business and find other business options to have a bigger income for his family.

loans.use: to buy crab traps, fishing net, and more fish

loans.name: Miflinso Mahugnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MIFLINSO MAHUGNON est composé de deux personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Bintou est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Bintou est âgée de 56 ans et vit au Bénin. Bintou a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Bintou est mariée à un certain Nicodème. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et dont quatre à leur charge. Bintou vit avec ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari, les divers besoins du ménage. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Bintou vend depuis sept ans, des ignames frits, des beignets et de l’huile végétale à son domicile. Bintou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Bintou sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MIFLINSO MAHUGNON, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra surement à hausser le niveau de leur activité et à se faire plus de profit.
texts.en:
The group MIFLINSO MAHUGNON consists of two members who live in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative is Bintou, seen with her hand raised in the photo. 

Bintou, age 56, lives in Benin. She left school at the primary level. She is married to a man named Nicodème, and the couple have five children who have all received schooling, four of whom are still in their care. Bintou lives with her children, and she handles the various household responsibilities together with her husband. To that end, Bintou has been selling fried yams, beignets and vegetable oil from her home for the past seven years. She buys her supplies at a market in Benin. 

To achieve customer satisfaction and to increase her sales and revenue, Bintou is seeking a loan from ALIDé together with the other member of MIFLINSO MAHUGNON. This loan will help them to bolster their activity and boost their profits.

loans.use: to buy yams, beans, and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en: Jesus is 35 years old from the community of Nocnocan, Talibon, Bohol. He is married with one child. Jesus has been engaged in a fishing business for 6 years now. He is asking for a loan to buy a fishing net, fish hooks and gasoline in order to make the most out of his time at sea. He is optimistic that as long as he works hard, there is so much in store for him out of fishing. His income will be for his child's needs and family daily consumption.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, fish hooks and gasoline

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of two school-going children, Josephine works hard to support her family. She operates a beauty salon and also earns additional income from a relative's contributions. Josephine is borrowing 10,000 KES through Yehu to purchase additional beauty cosmetics and chemicals for her salon.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from Yehu. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money, which she will use to expand her business, educate her two children, and provide for them a quality life.

loans.use: to purchase additional beauty cosmetics and chemicals for her salon.

loans.name: Elise Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ELISE est composé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Pascaline Olamidé est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Pascaline Olamidé est âgée de 39 ans et vit au Bénin. Pascaline Olamidé n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pascaline Olamidé est mariée à un maçon du nom de Jérôme. Le couple a trois enfants dont aucun scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Pascaline Olamidé vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Pascaline Olamidé vend du pain et des sachets depuis six ans à son domicile. Pascaline Olamidé s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Pascaline Olamidé sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ELISE, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The group ELISE is composed of three persons who live in the same district. The group's representative, Pascaline Olamidé, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 39 years old and lives in Benin. She did not attend school. She is married to a mason named Jérôme. The couple have three children, none in school but all in their care. Pascaline Olamidé lives together with her husband and children. The couple jointly ensure that the different household expenses are covered.

To make sure the diverse household expenses are covered, Pascaline Olamidé has been selling bread and plastic pouches out of her home for six years. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and revenues, Pascaline Olamidé is requesting, along with the other members of the group ELISE, a loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy bread and plastic pouches

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es: Salvador de cuarenta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a sus hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo es de gran incidencia agrícola y esta cercano al lugar donde vive lo cual lo beneficia porque aprovecha mas su tiempo en la labor, comercia en todas las zonas cercanas a su comunidad y ya tiene mucha clientela las personas las prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan a precios realmente accesibles; Salvador es un hombre positivo siempre dispuesto a salir adelante, quiere alcanzar sus sueños y llegar al éxito, en esta temporada de siembra quiere aumentar la producción pero necesita capital para invertir por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, insecticida, herbicida, herramienta, etc. Salvador tiene buenas referencias de crédito y asegura poder cancelar la deuda y a la vez darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Salvador, 44 years old, lives with his children and works cultivating corn. He has been working in agriculture for many years and his many years of experience have enabled him to obtain the best harvests. The land that he cultivates is very good for agriculture and it is close to where he lives which enables him to take advantage of more time with his work. He sells in all of the areas near his community and he has many clients who prefer his goods because he always has what they need at reasonable prices. 

Salvador is a positive man who is always open to the idea of getting ahead. He would like to achieve his dreams and be successful. In this planting season he would like to increase his production but he needs capital to invest. As a result, he is asking Apoyo Integral for a loan that will allow him to buy corn seeds, insecticide, herbicide and tools among other things. Salvador has good credit references and he promises he will be able to repay his debt, at the same time giving his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, insecticide, herbicide, and tools

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is 35 years old and lives in Nocnocan, Talibon, Bohol with her husband and two children, who are nine and 11 years old. She earns a living by running a sari-sari (or variety) store, which is how she helps support her family. She is requesting a loan to buy fish, meat and rice to sell to her customers. The additional income she earns as a result of this loan will allow her to feed her children a nutritious diet, and pay their school fees on-time. She plans to invest more in her business in the future so she can maximize her profit and provide her family a good life.

loans.use: to buy fish, meat and rice to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Señor De Exaltación Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SEÑOR DE EXALTACIÓN II” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maritza es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de verduras, venta de frutas, venta de refrescos, venta de gorros, venta de chirimoyas, venta de helados.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Maritza es una integrante, ella indica que desde hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa a invitarla. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de joyas, mismo que emprendió por iniciativa propio desde hace tiempo atrás, aprendiendo este de amigas que trabajaban en este negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para incremento de capital (compra de joyas) mismo que comprará de las empresas distribuidoras de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su comunidad. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a sus padres y mantenerse económicamente ella ya que es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
“Señor de Exaltacion II” Community Bank will start its third cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Achacachi Community Center. It is composed of ten members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Maritza. The members engage in different economic activities, such as selling vegetable, selling fruits, selling soft drinks, selling hats, selling custard-apples and selling ice-creams.

Maritza is one of the micro entrepreneurs forming this group, and she will benefit from the requested loan. Maritza says she has been a member of Pro Mujer for three years, and that she has been invited to enter by one of the promoters of this institution who went to her house to invite her. She currently sells jewels, an activity she stared a few years ago out of her own initiative.

The loan she is currently requesting will be used to increase her working capital by buying jewels. She will buy them from supplying companies in La Paz to the sell them in her community. She is single, and this type of activity allows her to support her parents as much as she can and support herself economically, since she is single.

When asked about it, she says that the seminars on health and the loans are what she likes the most of Pro Mujer.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry for resale

loans.name: Mallku Irpiri 2 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MALLKU IRPIRI 2” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Tomasa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejido de mantas a macramé, venta de frutas, tejido y venta, venta de cosméticos y peluches, venta de hamburguesas, peluquería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Tomasa es una integrante, ella indica que desde hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de atención de peluquería, mismo que trabaja hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de su esposo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para ampliar y mejorar el negocio (compra de espejos y máquinas de cortar cabello) que comprará de las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud.
texts.en:
Mallku Irpiri 2 Communal Bank will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Regional Office.  It is made up of six members headed by a board of directors of which Tomasa is the president.  The businesses carried out by the members of the communal bank are varied, including macrame weaving of blankets, fruit sales, weaving and sales, cosmetics and stuffed animal sales, hamburger sales, and hairdressing.

The loan they're going to get will benefit small business owners of which Tomasa is a member.  She indicates that for five years she has been a member of Pro Mujer, joining on the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution.  Currently she has a hairdressing business, the same one she has worked in for years, having learned it from her husband.

The loan she's going to receive now is to expand and improve her business by buying mirrors and machines, which she will buy in the markets in the city of El Alto and install later in her sales space.  This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family as much as possible, because she lives with her partner and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health training.

loans.use: to buy a mirror and hair cutting machines

loans.name: José Eduardo

texts.es: José Eduardo de cuarenta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a  su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia. Él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite obtener en cada siembra las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo es muy accesible y con suelo fértil además esta cerca de su residencia lo cual es favorable para la producción, comercia en las zonas aledañas a la comunidad y tiene mucha clientela que lo prefieren porque siempre quedan satisfechas con la calidad de producto, buenos precios pero sobre todo un excelente servicio; José es un hombre inigualable se caracteriza por su gran perseverancia y amor al trabajo, su mas grande meta es alcanzar el éxito y esta esforzándose mucho para lograrlo, en la época de siembra anterior tuvo algunas perdidas y quiere recuperarse pero necesita comprar insumos por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, abono, insecticida, herramienta etc. José Eduardo tiene buenas referencias de crédito y tiene una moral intachable asegura cancelar la deuda y a la vez le ofrece a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
José Eduardo, age 44, lives with his life partner and their children in his own house.  He grows corn and beans. He has several years of valuable experience farming.  This allows him to get the best harvests with each planting.

The land that he sows is very accessible and has fertile soil.  It is also close to his home, which is favorable for production.  He sells in all of the areas close to his community.
